text: Bright gold opaque pour, bubbly body and head - probably the nicest-looking weizen Ive found. Lovely sugary and banana bread nose - notes of candied cherry, gingerbread, lemon. Taste is brown-sugar sweet, ripe banana, cherry, lemon. Spicy finish. Could use a bit more grain or hop to counteract the sweetness - but still excellent. Palate is velvety and luxurious. Overall - holy crap!

Classic German beer. I liked the style, though I prefer beer stronger, darker, more complex. Like its sister Celebrator, a real wonder. That if, if I buy it and the tastaré, especially in Germany and barrel

Ar: Pungent, slightly tangy banana; clove and black pepper; perfume; tart peach skins. Ap: Slightly hazy orange; very large yellow-tan head with exceptional retention; leaves an everlasting, latte-like foam cap. T: Burst of bananas and peaches; very slight cotton candy; hints of pineapple; fairly tart, almost sour but exceptionally clean acidity; chalk and medium-low bitterness on the finish; bit of black pepper throughout. P: Medium body with very hight carbonation; finish is dry and very crisp. O: This beer has a real punch; the fruit flavors are huge, the acidity is bright, and the spice really pops; richness of body is very nice, too.

Head is Huge very creamy dense, ivory white and long lasting, perfect! Beer is dark orange and unclear. Aroma is gentle and of ripe banana, yeast, a bit of cinnamon and alcohol. Taste is wheaty, medium malty sweet, fruity yeasty and sadly a bit underwhelming,though its still good. Finish is sweet bitter medium intense and average long. Carbonation is like gone. Despite this its overall ok, maybe Ill have to give it next time another chance.
Plátano, manzana verde, vainilla y toque cítrico, cilantro. El aroma y el trago es muy limpio, jugosa en boca con final seco.
Part of the LCBO Spring collection, a definite premium beer, a reference for this style. lack a bit of the silkiness of the belgian quad to get full score.

Hazy Orange yellow colour with white head. Aroma yeast banana and herbal. Taste saft sweet malt with a silky texture. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy mustard gold color. Topped by a thick white merengue-like head. Fragrant doughy wheat malt aroma is sweet and fruity. Big sweet malt flavor has notes of wheat, honey lemon, bread and cloves. The alcohol is well hidden. Finishes chewy and malty with yeasty notes.

Esters, tangerine, orange, sweet grain malts, caramel, tangerine milkshake. Hazy, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Medium sweet. More creamy tangerine milkshake, esters, sweet grain malts, caramel, orange, soft carbonation, full bodied. Outstanding Weizenbock, exceptionally nice aroma, rich, refreshing, superbly balanced. Bottle from Hopfen & Malz, Berlin.

Pours a hazy deep golden color with medium to huge white head. Aroma is sweet, with strong overriped banana, clove and yeast and a mdoerate bready backbone. Taste follows the nose. Again, strong banana flavours together with a marked spicy character and a strong biscuity yet bready back-end.
Color amarillento tostado con espuma blanca Sabores cereales con ligeros toques de herbaceos y cítricos. Suaves afrutados. Ligero ligero amargo final dulce. Cuerpo ligero algo espumoso y seco. Buena

Bottle 33cl. poured into a weizen glass. Murky orange, small fizzy off-white head, dissapears within seconds, minimal lacing; aroma malt, banana, yeast, toffee, cloves; taste light heavy sweet and slightly bitter, yeasty, fruity, spicy notes; lingering sweetbitter aftertaste, fruity and spicy notes; medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation; nice but less good than expected.
Botella @IXCata Ratebeer Asturias, 10/04/17. BBD:12/17. Color amarillo pajizo, corona de espuma blanca, aromas a levadura notas a plátano banana, sabor a cereal cuerpo medio.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 0.33l bottle from getränke oase in münchen. pours a murky orange with a small white head. aroma of banana, apricots, perfume, coriander. flavour of banana bread, apricots, oranges. quite fruity and yeasty.
500ml; Cloudy fizzy dark gold, persistent head; wheat, rye, grass, coriander, banana, black pepper, green pepper, feels slick and smooth, thick and light; Very good.
Отлично& креплен& пиво, хороший аромат и сбаланс& вкус! Пьется достато& легко. (Bottle 0,33/ 7,1%)
500ml bottle from Savor Growl: hazy gold, sturdy white head. aroma of pleasant biscuit, banana, candied. tastes are along the same lines - evenly done. citrus, hay, dusty. creamy palate.

Bottle.

A- Bubblegum, banana, clove, spicy yeast.

A- Dark yellow color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Spicy yeast, clove, bubblegun, banana.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, spiced finish,

O-Generally, I have felt that Ayinger is a touch overrated but this one was pretty good.

Cloudy deep gold. Super tasty aroma full of banana bread. A spicy, fruity nectar. The nose suggests clove, pepper, cardamom, nutmeg, brown sugar, tons of banana, milk chocolate, mango. Wonderful. On the tongue, its rich and fruity but doesnt quite rise to the depth and complexity of the aroma. Lovely nonetheless. Banana bread again is the dominant note. Marshmallowy, super smooth texture. Short but sweet aftertaste. A perfect go-to.

Pours cloudy gold with a huge white head that sticks around through the whole drink. Aroma is floral and citrusy. Taste is moderately sweet. There are notes of oranges, both rind and blossom, bananas, leather, spicy phenolics, and grainy malt. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. The orange and banana flavours are the most prominent but they cant really be described as strong and that is really what makes this beer so good. Every flavour has its place and nothing dominates.

Bottle from SinH4. Thank you so much! Amber gold with a big off-white head that quickly fades into a small rim. Aroma of ripe banana, cassis, wheat malt, distinct aroma of yeast, leather, alcoholic fermentation, spice. All very clearly distinguishable. Taste is medium sweet, very round. Medium to full body, creamy, with pearly, soft carbonation. Lingering fruity finish. 
Besides the obvious banana and fruit, fermentation and yeast dominate the aroma. Not in a bad way - its not messy, but very clean. Very round, not too sweet, no overbearing notes. Nice!

Cloudy ochre yellow, moderate white head. Notable lacing. Spicy yeast, banana, fruit. Noble. Medium body. Smoothest mouthfeel. Lots of clove on taste with supporting banana, fruity yeast. Low bitterness. Cool.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Deep golden color with a white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Flavor is complex with a sweet fruitiness, a touch of caramel and just a little clove spiciness. Finish is short and sweet. Makes me wish they had not stopped making their Maibock.

Bottle, BB 10.17 (thanks EuroSanta SinH4). Pours golden with huge whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, fruits, wheat, banana, citrus, strawberries. Flavor is very sweet, fruits, wheat, strawberries, banana. Finish is sweet banana. Alcohol is well covered, only some warmth in the throat. Overall: great beer, bit too much on the sweet side maybe.

the aroma is fruity and malty with hints of banana, toffee, caramel, yeast, candy and some spices... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of apple, candy, toffee, yeast and brown sugar... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Bottle - hazy yellow color, nice creamy head. Taste is moderate banana, spices, yeasty. Mouthfeel is great, silk-like. Strong body, alcohol well hidden. a nice beer from a style I usually dont really like.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks for this one. BB 12/2017. orange cloudy color, medium big white head. smells yeasty, caramel, banana, light tobacco, bit citric, ok smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of caramel, some sweetness, spices, some peach, banana, nice fruit notes. finishes lightly dry and lightly sweet with notes of banana, peach and spices. smell is ok, but taste is very nice, although a bit on the sweet side. quite nice to drink.

bottle bbe 10/17 orange cloudy good head fruity banana light pepper smooth low hoppy note medium body arancio scarico torbida buona schiuma discreta persistenza fruttato banana leggera pepata morbida poco luppolato discreto corpo

Pours a hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma is of cloves and malt. All I taste is cloves but its not overpowering at all. New style of beer for me. I think its a good beer and worth trying but I probably wont have it again.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. Christmas gift from SecretSanta ! A "dirty" yellow opaque beer with a big white head ; good retention. Clove, overriped banana, herbal note, sugar. Medium to heavy sweet, light dry bitter refreshing, quite warming, light spicy. Medium heavy body, oily texture, average carbonation, sweet fruity spicy finish. Overall, fair ; sugary ; "heavy" german weizen.

Aroma is fruity, wheat, caramel, yeast, banana, clove. Appearance is very hazy, off white head, amber golden. Taste is fruity, wheat, caramel, yeast, banana, clove, somewhat dry. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, soft, dry fruity wheat aftertaste. Overall, a well made Weizen Bock.

Cloudy tan with a fair bit of effervescence showing through in my (unfortunately) seldom-used weizen glass. Medium, even head. Has an aroma reminescent of that jarred apple sauce we had when I was a kid...not so much nostalgic because that was the shittiest apple sauce, when my mom wasnt into making the real stuff. That there is more, and richer, malt, than in a normal weizen is quite apparent on this nose as well. Highly carbonated (as expected), sweet, with a fair bit of apple-pear, and a strong, vaguely bready malt base, though one with a touch of plasticy phenols as well. Finishes sweet, again appley, with some complexity but maybe not enough to help me look past those phenols, which follow me right to the death.
330ml bottle. Pours hazy gold with a large pillowy off-white head. Aroma is wheat, banana bread, spices. Taste is sweet, malty, banana, yeast, toffee.
Butelka 0,33l. Aromat intensywny i przyjemny, głównie goździkowy, kwiatowy, w tle banan. W smaku za to dominuje słodki banan, bardzo przyjemnie. Goryczka niska.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Ar: Jak swietny weizen, banany niesamowite, swiezosc, troche ananasa, fajna intensywnosc, soczystosc, slod, pszenica, nuty ziarna, wow.Wyg: Metny, nieprzejrzysty, zoltawy, gruba roznoziarnista piana, rasowy weizen.Sm: Super, mega banany, pszenica, slodowo, ziarno mlocone, leciutkie, gladkie, minimalna goryczka, nie muli jak klasyczny  weizen, zajebiste.Pos: Pszenica, ziarno, banany, slodycz, odrobina milej, slodowej goryczki.

500 ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have banana, cloves, hints of caramel, bready wheat malts, always around surprising it took this long to rate.
Poured hazy orange with lots of white head. Aroma is malt and barnyard yeast. Taste is very sweet with no bitterness at all.

Scents of barnyard yeast and malt with some sweet overtones. Pours a cloudy orange with a thin white head of microscopic bubbles. Broad flavors of apricot jam, bananas, esters and alcohol. Big broad tastes with a short almost dry finish. Very carbonated.

If the grey, gloomy weather is any indicator, winter is already on the way. Thankfully theres some cold-weather appropriate wheat beer from Ayinger to ease the transition into that season. This Weizen Bock pours cloudy gold with a pure white head. Grainy and mildly fruity aroma. Cereal grain, apple, and banana. Smooth, creamy feel and finish. For something straight out of Aying, this is about as authentic as you could hope for. Damn easy to drink, too.

First weizenbock Ive tried and wasnt sure what to expect. Familiar hefeweizen flavours but much more complexity. Frothy tasty head. Fruity aroma of banana and apple, grass and wheat, sweet honey as well. Taste is predominantly sweet and sour with low bitterness. Flavours- has some sour notes or citrus, coriander/spices. Low alcohol taste for its ABV (7.1%). Sticky and oily mouthfeel, definitely full bodied and warm. Appearance goes murky near the end of the bottle. Finish is smooth, sweet and dry.
Bottle. Poured a goldenyeast, color with a larger sized head. Fruity/bananas, yeasty, and cloves. Blah but not offensive.

Bottle - 500ml. Beautiful hazy, golden body with an average white foamy/creamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty, banana, and citrusy hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its relatively complex taste carries woody, fruity, and yeasty notes. Ends with a bittersweet, moderately warming finish. More Hefeweizen than Bock.

Bottle from Julios. Not sure how fresh it is. Big white head upon opening. Otherwise this settled very nicely. Cloudy light orange color. Soft fruity bready texture. Classic banana and clove flavor. A supercharged hefe. Ayinger always makes good stuff. I am pleased with this one. Would love to try a fresher bottle.

A tad pale for a weizenbock, but who cares. The flavors divine. Appearance has a colossal thick billowy cream colored head. Aromas traditional Bavarian hefeweizen with clove banana malt. Flavors like nose, plus with the bock a touch more sweet. Still enough tang to make it so drinkable. These guys have it together.
On tap hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat bread andgrass. Taste follows nose.

Un grand merci à Ju-Lo pour le partage de cette délicieuse blanche que nous nous sommes envoyée en ce 500e anniversaire de la loi de la pureté allemande - loi qui fit son entrée en vigueur en 1516. Alles Gute zum Geburtstag! Nez de bananes vertes sur le point dêtre mûres, dépices, de céréales blanches et dune douce levure gomme-balloune. Douceur parfaite en bouche. Le liquide me coule en bouche avec une douceur des plus appréciables, laissant dans son sillon un délicat arrière-goût de blé, de cardamone et de cette banane verte et trop fraîche. Tout simplement délicieuse et facile à boire!

500 mml bottle tasted on the 27/07/2016. Cloudy pale orange colour with a nice and thick white head. Aroma of wheat, banana and cerals. Taste is mid fruity and grainy with some caramel and yeast. Next one please!

Pours dirty orange from the bottle. The head is bubbly and rapidly collapses. Lots and lots of evident carbonation. The aroma is yeasty. Taste trends sour at the outset, with an underlying sweetness. The carbonation is quite aggressive on the palate during the first few sips, much more in line with a soda than a bock beer. Then the surprise. The palate settles down and the beer takes on a new depth. The sourness becomes less pervasive, and an apple pie sweetness takes over. The aroma also becomes more nuanced, an interesting mix of ripe banana and pear settles over the yeasty background. 
By the end of my bottle, about 25 minutes later, the palate was very nearly flat. The swings in the palate are disconcerting. Amazingly despite 7.1% there was no trace of alcohol, and not even much warmth.
An intriguing beer. Going to have to drink a couple of these to fully make up my mind.

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo ma srednia piane i srednio trwala. Jak na pszenicznego kozlaka to nie jest zbyt ciezkie. Metne i to bardzo, morelowa barwa i zapach pomaranczowej skorki, bardzo silny aromat gruszek i bananow. W smaku nmus jabjkowo bananowy, melon i odrobina przyprawy chyba z kurkuma mi sie kojarzylo lub curry. Bardzo smaczne wyraziste i po prostu smaczne piwo. Alkoholu jak na ten styl stosunkowo malo, polecam

500ml bottle. Pours a murky orange, with an active white head that thins to a thick film. Aroma has big notes of banana, citrus, bread, candy sugar, fruity esters, and slight spice. Taste is balanced. Banana, bread, caramel, dark candy sugar, apple, citrus, and slight toffee fudge at the end. Delicious. Medium-full body with a medium-high carbonation. Clean and active in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall a very enjoyable beer. Lots of banana, caramel, citrus, bread, toffee, candy sugar, and a dry, easy drinking finish.

Bottle received in the local European swap, thanks to SinH4. Hazy golden with a large white head with good retention and lace. Nose has banana, honey, flowers, hay, strawberries. Fruity with some dusty hay beneath. Flavour is likewise fruity; dried banana, sugared fruit, hay, honey, flowers. Medium body, soft carbonation, sweet with little bitterness. Sweet and fruity finish. No alcohol showing. Slightly sticky finish, otherwise fine beer.
Bottle at csakajosor. Hazy straw yellow colour with a longlasting white head. Nose is dominated by hay like weizen notes. Taste is medium sweetness low to no bitterness. Low carbonation. Nice.

500ml bottle. Hazy honey gold hue, with thick fluffy white head, with a nice bananaish, spicy, fruity, yeasty, doughy nose, with some banana bread, raisin pie, apple pie, nutmeg, subtle honey lollipop accents, with some honeyed wheat, pale, toasted malt, apple strudel, apple sauce notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very good spicy, fruity weizen yeast, spiced banana cake, honeyish wheat, pale, toasted malty, honeyed breadcrumbs, cinnamon apple pie character, with some apple strudel, apple sauce, raisin pie, mild candyish honey lollipop, clove flavors, leading towards a mild warming spicy, fruity, doughy yeastiness, honeyed wheat, pale maltiness, lingering apple strudel pastryish finish.

Bottle from LCBO in Oakville. Aroma of fruit sweetness. Very sweet flavor of ripe bananas and candy sugars . Virtually no bitterness and not boozy at all despite being 7.1% abv. Full bodied. One of the best of this style Ive had.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. A candy weizenbock, how unusual! Has the air of a Belgian ale made with wheat. Sweet and oily, yet not boozy at all. Low but crisp carbonation carrying all that, with the support of a little cider-like sourness. Some ripe banana, but really not all that much.

500ml. How the hell have I never rated an Aying thats always available around me? Lazy, lazy beer nerd. Depriving myself of the delights of good German beer, too. Pours a very cloudy bright medium yellow with tons of platinum blond lacing on top. Tangy sweet nose, showing husky wheat and bright herbal hop notes. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Tangy wheat and sweet herbal hop on the mid palate with a crisp finish.

Ar- bready malt combine with significant banana and clove with a hint of vanilla. 

Ap- cloudy golden pours a nice fluffy head. 

Fl- sweet bread malty flavor is joined by bananas, cloves and hints of bubblegum. No hop flavor. 

Mf- full bodied, hint of alcohol warming, nice carbonation

Ov- very nice beer, want a little more bready malt to balance out the fruit esters but hey, not complaining :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy golden with a medium foamy white head. Aromas of esters, bananas, farmhouse, parsnip, ripe apple. Taste is fruity sweetness with musky nutty notes.

Ayinger Weizenbock (DE) - Weizen Bock - 7.1% - 4.3/5

33 cl bottle i bought over from Aying last summer, BB 11.2015. Cloudy orange color, big creamy and expansive white to yellowish head, persistent. Very perfumed. Classic weizen aroma, lots of fruit and banana, dough, yeast and some citrus in the finish.
Thick bready body, relatively soft carbonation. Taste is sweetish, moderately tart, ultra tasty, umami. Dusty aromatic finish. The ABV cant be felt so high, seems close to the urweizen. Delicious weizenbock, loved it, sadly very hard to find.

Bottle 0,33l. Cloudy pale orange liquid with big soft creamy foam. Very nice looking. Medium body, medium to heavy carbonation. Aroma of grains and a hint of banana. Taste of wheat and fruits. Could taste some alcohol. Nice but a bit too carbonated for my taste.

Bottle. Heavy yeasty aroma. Aroma of wheat and banana with notes of cloves and corriander. The flavours is sweet at first but finish light bitter. Balanced. The body is medium and the texture is chewie. Average lively carbonation. Good one...
0.33l bottle. Hazy orange color with creamy white head. Aroma is cloves, banana and wheat. Taste is sweet with banana, cloves and wheat. Medium body. Overall its great and balanced beer.
I think I smelled some hazelnut and white bread together with the usual weizen aroma. Taste is surprisingly sweet and very round. Overall a smooth experience that I would like to repeat.
Auf dem Gendarmenmarkt-Weihnachtsmarkt in Berlin (Flasche). Aroma: Weizen, Banane, Vanilie. Schmeckt wie Bananensaft, nicht mein Geschmack

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark gold with a high, creamy, fine-grained, butterscotch-colored head. The nose is toffee, phenols, fresh bread, tropical fruit, and jalapenos (swear to Bes). On the tongue, that is a LOT of banana and clove; damn near Platonic in its intensity. Incredibly smooth and rich; theres a butterscotch syrup sweetness and luxuriousness to it. The finish dries out a little and picks up some more clove and a touch of allspice. Im not fond of this style and I like this -- though I think Id stop at one. Nice.

L:
-pours a cloudy bright golden with a medium to big,foamy,white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-fresh,lemon,clove,banana,pineapple,b gum,grapefruit,white bread,slightly herbal
T:
-honey,lemon,tangerines,white pepper,clove,pineapple,sorbet
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium to full body
-no alcohol detectable
O:
Great,fresh Weizenbock.
This would actually do well as a summer Beer,slightly cooled.

0,33l bottle. Hazy orange colour with big foamy head. The head quickly shrinking but stays long after it went small. Aroma: Fruity, banana, honey, vanilla. Taste: Sweet wheat taste with very light sour/bitter tones. Pleasent sweet finish. Medium body, mild carbonation, creamy texture. Great beer.
Bottle. Banana and vanilla aroma. Super smooth wheaty banana taste with clean lager finish.
500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a generous white head. Aroma is wheat. Taste is wheat, mild fruits. Very good.
Cloudy medium yellow pour, 2 finger off white head. Nose is yeast and soft fruit. Leans sweet. Middle is bright wheat, light malt, hints of apples. Finish is light and carbonated.

Bottle sample. Hazy deep gold with a creamy white head. Total banana bomb on the nose. Toasty sweet banana bread. Sort of nutty. Some brown sugar. Flavor is strong and sweet. Toffee and banana dessert. Clove. Full body, pretty rich. Nice.

caramel, bread, toast, floral, banana, bubblegum, clove, raisin.
orange, hazy, white foam, frothy, lightly bitter, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish, slight bitterness. drinkable, expected more, could be bore by style

0,33 l bottle. Murky pale orange in the glass, small white head. Some wheat and yeast on the nose. Taste is mid sweet fruity, followed by a more wheat sequence, some alcoholic hints. All in a smooth way with caramell. Enjoyed it a lot!
Bottle compliments of Indiana_Red: Grapey aroma with a light and malty structure and flavor.

Bottel, hazy deep golden witha full off white head. Lots of mild wheat malt aroma and a little sour tang. Mild weizen flavors, wheaty and a touch of the classic Bavarian yeast character. Nice mild beer.

Bottle from The Beer Shoppe, Yakima.
Aroma: Roasted caramel, grain, light bread, yeast
Palate: Medium bodied. Soft creamy texture.
Flavor: Soft, nutty and caramel malt with gentle underlying hop bitterness. Medium-long finish.
Comment: Delicious sweet maltiness without being cloying.
Slight sour smell, Hazy Orange-yellow colour. Very well rounded Taste, Petty Sweet,Light Sweet aftertaste

It pours nicely into a rich white head that has some staying power. Its cloudy dark gold and has an aroma of banana and clove, that also carries over to the flavour. Theres a very subtle spiciness to it and it leaves a very pleasing aftertaste. Highly recommended.
Bottle in Munich. Hazy amber body with top head. Nose is sweet, floral and bananas. Some sweetness. Taste sweet, fruity, of bananas, and malts. Really nice. Nice carbonation. Really well done.

0.33 l bottle from REWE Budnik & Homberg, bottled in November 2014. Murky, golden yellow with a huge, foamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-spicy aroma of banana, clove, honeydew, vanilla and citrus. Sweetish, fruity-spicy taste of banana, honeydew, vanilla, bubblegum and some clove, followed by a short, slightly sourish and minimally bitter, smooth-yeasty finish. Medium to full body, very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Archetype-Weizenbock, great!

Bottle at MacCools in Layton. Golden color with a big fluffy white head. The aroma had lots of banana ester and yeast. The flavor was bold with a hint of spice and a touch of booziness. Pretty filling beer but the bold taste held up well against the heavy Irish dinner.
Hazy dark yellow. Lasting Frothy white head. Aroma and flavor find Thick wheat. Citrus. Some spice. Honey cereal. Yeasty. Medium body. Sweet. Another please..
Good beer. light, creamy, frtohy, citrus, yeast, delicious. good beer to have with good people.
Nose is banana esters and a muddled fruity goodness. Taste is banana bread, some citrus, fruity esters. Lots a flavour, full bodied yet refreshing. This is great beer.
Substantial aroma. Wheat and banana that is good with heavier meals. Nice head retention.

Bottle at home. Hazy Yellow with a thick White head. Big yeasty aroma with banana, clove and spice. Pie-like. Doughy flavour with more banana, cloves and booze. Its a bit like a hefe syrup that you could use to make hefe in a sodastream machine.
Pours orange with thick white head. Aroma ofbread, banana, honey and raisin. Tastes of same with lingering aftertaste. Really nice. Up there with aventinus.
Bottle, 330 ml form Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Wheat, fruit, banana, yeast. Bit spicy. Sweetish, medium bodied.
This is good enough to pull me away from Erdinger, not to mention Hacker and Paulaner. Summer could be as hazy as the color of this beauty.

Cloudy light orange with a tall, fluffy, long-lasting off-white head.
The aroma is fresh yeasty dough, banana, and spice.
The flavor is lightly sweet with the banana and spice that were in the aroma.
Creamy smooth body. Very nice.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy amber color bock with a large off-white foamy head with great retention and some lacing. Aroma of banana bread ester is just about perfect with just the right amount of residual sugar. Taste is also a near perfect mix of banana bread with sweet wheat malt notes and light cloves undertones. Body is pretty full for style with great carbonation. This is pretty close to style staple as Ive tasted.

Immediately upon uncapping, the banana esters and Belgian wheat are present in the room. Wheat and coriander soon join the party. Bit of pear too. Its a beautiful looking beer, with an unfiltered, almost pumpkin colouring to it.
Tastes are very reflective of the aromas. The mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy.
Very good quality wheat beer, that I would have no hesitation to buy again.

Pint bottle. Hazy dingy golden. A fluffy off white head. I smell hefeweizen aromas. Bananas and cloves and those are tasted. Some pepper and other spices. And then some yeast. This has all the markings of a classic. Not a fault to be found. But it is a weizen.

Cloudy orange colour, huge white creamy head, aroma of banana, clove, yeast, lemon and dough. Taste is light medium sweet, slightly sour. Medium body, oily slick texture, average carbonation. Very tasty.
50cl flaska. Dimmig gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft av vete, jäst och en aning citrus. I smaken tillkommer maltsötma och lite bubbelgum. Det senare är något jag inte uppskattar.

Standard bottle, poured into a weizen glass at ~40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a deep honey gold, so cloudy one can barely make out the shadows of their fingers on the other side of the glass, and forms a pale just-off-white head which dies away rather quickly. Lacing is fairly pedestrian.

Smell: Not unlike a wheat field near a mixed orchard of banana and pear trees bursting with ripeness, with bush-sized clumps of coriander and clove dotting the landscape.

Taste: Starting cold, this is heavy with coriander, intensely orange and citric, with supporting buttresses of banana and bubblegum flavors. As it warms, the coriander recedes to being one of several small towers, alongside the banana and bubblegum, with notes of clove and faint pear. It still strikes me as almost more wit-like than hefe-like.

Mouthfeel: Light, lively, bubbly, and refreshing.

Overall: A darned good beer, if not quite up to the standard of their Brau Weisse for me. This feels less like a concentrated weissbier and more like a blend of one with a wit, but thats hardly a bad thing in my book!
(bottle) hazy orange amber colour with a small pale beige head; aroma of spice, banana; clean, balanced flavour; creamy palate
Bottle. Pours hazy peach with pretty white head. Nose is bananas and cloves. Taste adds some nutmeg. Good.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
hazy golden yellow with a couple of fingers of dense white head. Good retention but little lacing.
Aroma:
Yeast, banana.
Flavours:
Banana, nutmeg, yeast, allspice, bubble gum.

A: Pours a wonderfully cloudy dark amber color, with a two-finger off-white color head. Retention and lacing are respectable, but not amazing. Also has the nice touch of little yeast sediment specs rising to the head.

S: Banana, cloves, bubblegum, coriander, a little apple, and a very faint noble aspect. Nothing groundbreaking, but it works very well.

T: Very much like a quality hefe, but sweeter on the whole. The banana on the opening is quite strong, while it finishes with a solid tartness from the apple-esque flavor, combined with a bit of spiciness. Alcohol is hidden very well, almost perfectly in fact, making this one quite dangerous.

M: Carbonation is on the high side...make that on the very high side (deriving from its bock strength, perhaps?), but is helped quite a bit by a smooth, somewhat creamy body. Superbly refreshing.

O: My only complaint is that the sweetness wears on me a tad as I progress through the beer. Otherwise, it strikes me as a unique twist on the classic hefe, and along with its stupid drinkablilty factor, makes it one thats well worth diving into.

Banana aroma but not overpowering. Bananas and fruit also present in the taste together with sweet malts. Big body and medium bitterness. Nice winterwarmer but no big drinkabillity.

500ml Bottle. Appearance is hazy dark orange color with thick beige head. Aroma is rich with wheat, citrus and other grains. Taste is heavy but very pleasant with flavors of banana, citrus, wheat, and roasted grains. Palate is medium bodied, full texture, average carbonation, and semi-dry finish. Wonderful Weizenbock.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2014 Delicious wheat aroma and full wheat flavor with citrus notes.  Great aftertaste that leaves you wanting.  Not dark for a bock but gives a nice full sweet caramel taste and is a great transition beer from winter to spring.
Full-bodied wheat bear. Heavy banana aroma. Flavor of banana, bread, cleves, and acidic straw.

A wonderful, unexpected pleasure.  im a fan of anything bock, anc was a bit surpriseed to see this one pour a hazt golden color.  the head is white and huge.  Nose is carmel and malty.  The first sip had me thinking WOW. Very rich aroma of bread, yeast, and caramel.  No foul aftertaste at all.  This is either the heaviest wheat beer or the lightest bock Ive tried, and one I would gladly try again.
Golden orange in color and cloudy with a decent sized off-white head. Aroma is of wheat, clove, citrus, yeast and fresh dough in the breadmaker. Taste is of dough, citrus, and yeast.

Aroma of butterscotch, champagne and a nice wheat.  Pours thick and straw-colored with just enough dreggs and head to make this look like a perfect weizen.  Taste is clean but sweet wheat and slight butterscotch-caramel notes.  Delicous but hard to drink too much of (maybe).

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 poured from bottle into a hefeweizen glass. Pours a hazy gold color with a nice foamy head.

very aromatic with a lot of aromas of bananas, spices, bubblegum, and some bits of grains.

Very smooth medium/full feel along with extremely good flavors of bananas, spices, malts and some grain flavors as well.

A delicious weizenbock. Not really that unexpected from ayinger as this is yet another excellent offering from them

pours a clear dark gold with fizzy off white, slightly brown head.  Aroma of fruity esters, golden raisin, apple juice.  Flavor is at first of sweet wheat, some bready yeast, with tons of fruit coming in on the finish, fruit bread, candied raisin / apple, pear, plum.  Tons of flavor but retains a medium, refreshing body with lively carbonation.  Very, very nice - Ayinger is always spot on.

Pours a hazy orange golden color  with a big  foamy white head.  Nose of banana and some clove Medium body with robust carbonation and good mouthfeel. Flavor is mostly wheat, with banana and clove. Finish is lots of banana.  Very tasty and well done. Love those bananas.

500ml bottle from the state store 
Appearance: Pours hazy golden with a medium sized white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Yeast, banana and peaches 
Taste: Malty, yeast, banana, grainy with a mild bitter and sweet finish 
Decent

Bottled, 33 cl. Pours hazy orange with a nice white head. Aroma: Banana, wheat, clove. Taste: Pleasant fruity sweetness, light bitterness. Banana flavours and wheat. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Good.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a massive white head, good retention/lace. Aroma is banana, clove, dough, honey, light citrus note. Taste is fresh baked wheat bread, ripe banana. Palate is soft, creamy, average carbonation, low bitterness. Awesome.

At a tasting, thanks beerandbeyond, pours an hazy orange with a decent head, aroma of brett, lemon, apple and banana, flavor of malt, bubblegum, fruity sweetness, finishes sweet, medium bodied, nice stuff

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks beerandbeyond. Cloudy orange color with a big white head. Estery fruity aroma with some banana and light bubblegum notes. Mellow sweetish fruity flavor. Medium-bodied. A nice refreshing Weizen Bock.
Pours hazy orange-copper with a massive, pillowy white head. The aroma is spicy, banana, wheat, and clove.  Each of these elements is present in the sweet, spicy, smooth flavor.  A tad boozy.

Bottle from my secret Santa, many thanks. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma of wheat, malt, banana, alcohol. Taste, banana, honey, citrus, hints of biscuit, spices. Alcohol is well hidden. Bittersweet finish. Nice Weizen bock.
Very dark pour.  Aroma of dark fruits, bananas, plums.  Heavy in the mouth.  Very malt laden.

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. Appearance is a fairly hazy gold to copper with a thick, white head of foam with specks of brown on the top. Aroma laden with banana and clove with touches of nutmeg and bread dough. Taste is definitely banana and vanilla up front moving to the spicy clove and sweet nutmeg with a bready aftertaste and a warming alcohol on the back of the throat. Mildly spritzy carbonation leaves a tingling on the tongue.

golden pour with a nice white frothy head.  nose is heavy on the fruits, coriander, clove, light malts. great on the palate, smooth wheaty flavor in the front followed by a barrage of oranges, cloves, musk, and wheat.

Poured into a 20 ounce pint glass.  Cloudy gold appearance with a three inch white head.  Aroma of banana and a little clove.  Taste is sweet fruits, light overripe banana, and light clove.  Lower carbonation, medium body, and smooth palate.

500mL bottle purchased at the Davis Beer Shoppe.  I dont reckon Ive ever seen this beer before...The aroma on this has a ton of fruity yeast esters which impart a nice citrus lemon character.  Some banana and clove notes are also quite obvious.  Light metallic notes and a little bit of gumball, too.  Nicely aromatic.  Pours an appropriately opaque and hazy golden-straw color.  The head is off-yellowish and fairly robust.  Starts with a nice sweet, cereal maltiness, which plays well with the lemony citrus esters.  The carbonation is quite high, which gives this a nice effervescent mouthfeel.  Finishes with a little more breadiness and a long metallic aftertaste.  This is a very well-crafted beer, but I could see how one would find this a little cloying.

Bottle. Hard to imagine a weizen bock with a better aroma. Sweet, with banana, alcohol, creaminess. Very inviting. A little thinner bodies than the aroma would suggest, at first impression. But as the palate adjusts, theres clearly plenty of flavor here. Alcohol doesnt really avail itself. A really nice beer. Surprised I havent had it before.

Cloudy yellow-gold wheat color with a creamy, resilient, cream colored head. Aroma full of spice, with wheat, banana, sweet bread, and honey. Taste is yeasty and malty with a fair amount of spice. Medium-full bodied and pretty smooth.

500ml brown bottle. Hazy honey gold colour. Head is creamy and thick with an uneven top, the lace is clingy and coats the glass nicely. Nose has thick wheat malt, bread, honey. Taste has some sweetness up front, honey, wheat, bread, some banana fruitiness. Soft and smooth body, mellow carbonation. A classic weizenbock.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy peach color with a fluffy white head that recedes quickly to a small ring. Nose is banana, clove, muffins, flowers. Palate is full with a nice bite and a light bitter finish like a pinch that you are not dreaming. Flavors of clove, banana, dry, yeasty, yum.

Not as good as the Lagunitas and that surprises me.  Slight haze in this light orange nectar.  Thick creamy head with Decent retention and no lacing.   Some earthy basement funk going along with a bit of banana.  Palate is a bit sour, mellow, a bit of banana.  Not a lot going on.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a massive white head, good retention/lace. Aroma is banana, clove, dough, honey, light citrus note. Taste is fresh baked wheat bread, ripe banana. Palate is soft, creamy, average carbonation, low bitterness. Awesome.

Bottle: &nbsp Hazy straw with an orangish tinge, large foamy white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Pale wheaty nose, 

slight breadiness. &nbsp Similar tongue, mild sweetness. &nbsp Compared to Aventinus it pales. &nbsp Decent, a little 

light in aroma and flavor, but still has a decent body. &nbsp Tiz okay, but could use a little more spiciness.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2011 This pours of a cloudy yellow body with a thin off white head and some beautiful carbonation. The head dies and leaves some short lived spotty lacing. The nose is malted well with a big wheat aroma and a lovely German yeast. Big spice notes of hints of cloves and coriander. No hops but a noticable bubblegum and banana bread nose. The taste is very similar with a sweet and wheaty malt middle and a nice citrus note. The yeast has a nice fruit component with a clove spice and a sweet barnyard(kind of) and banana taste. A hint of alcohol on the finish. This beer has a big chewy malt with a full body. Overall, a spectacular Weizen Bock.

16.9 oz bottle.  Cant believe it took me so long to try this especially considering how cool the label is.  Foggy yellow brown with a smooth white head.  Nose is dough, honey, clove, melon and plantain.  Lovely.  Creamy medium body with refreshing spiky carb.  Taste is caramel and clove, banana with hints of tobacco.  I would give this the nod over Aventinus.  My new standard for WBs.

Bottle at Bluebird. Pours looking an awful lot like a hefeweizen, pale gold with a lot of haze. Big fluffy head. Nose is full of banana and cloves, light citrus note, yeast and bread. On tasting, its a big, full bodied wheat beer. Lacks the caramelly notes that can be offputting. Lots of great esters and clovey phenols. Big bready malts and a nice quenching tartness. Absolutely fantastic wheat beer.

33 cl bottle. BBE 06/2012.
Originally rated on 20090419. (7+3+7+4+14)
Pours cloudy golden colour with medium white head. Aroma of wheat, apricot, hay, light malts, distant spices and yeast. Flavour of apricot, wheat, malts, toffee, light spices and mild lemon. Medium-bodied, mild CO2, sweet and slick palate with a slight bitter finish. Well balanced brew.
5436

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange yellow with a large white head. Aroma is banana and clove, some wheat and tones of perfume. Taste is tons of clove and wheat, some ripe and sweet banana, also herbalness. Finish is herbal and clove. Palate is full, no carbonation.
Bottle. Pours hazy light orange/yellow much like wheat beer does. Aroma wheats, banana and orange peels. Not Bad.

500ml bottle from Picks Liquors in Carbondale. Pours a cloudy orange/yellow with a short lived off white head. Aroma of banana, citrus, some wheat and clove. Taste is banana, orange peel, an abundance of wheat with a slight hint of clove as well and a slight spice. Medium carbonation with a pleasant mouth feel. Overall a another solid beer from Ayinger.
Hazy orange with white head. Fruits, wheat and sweetness here. I like the mouthfeel. Good beer.

500ml bottle poured a slightly hazy golden color with 2 fingers of white head which settled nicely to some fine lacing.  Aroma is lightly toasted malts with banana and cloves.  Taste is malty sweet with some banana and cloves and a light hoppy bitter finish.  A very nice representation of this style of beer.  Very tasty.

16.9 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy cantaloupe hue with a large off-white pillowy head with great retention. Aroma is nice and clovey, banana-ey (yeah, I said banana-ey). Taste is sweet and spicy; refreshing. Highly carbonated with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Very nice weizen bock, a style thats fast becoming one of my favorites.

Appearance:  like carbonated orange/banana juice, with a one-finger off-white head and minimal lacing.   Aroma: bananas, wheat, cloves, cinnamon, hint of citrus and peppercorn.   Taste: cracked wheat, banana, yeasty spices.   Finish: tingly crisp, with all flavors slowly fading in concert.   Notes: Not much to say.  Delicious, balanced, drinkable, spicy.  The usual superlative beer from Ayinger.

My first real craft beer. This one holds a special spot, get your tissues for this. This really set it off about a year and 1000 beers ago. Wasnt reviewing at the time. Huge pillowy head. Great ripened bananas in the aroma with some wheat. Spicy banana flavor with a crisp body wheat finish. Awesome beer.

Bottle. A good beer but not one of my favorites. Balanced with many flavors. Sweet at the end with a lingering after taste. Coming from Ayinger I am sure that this is an above average representation of the style.

Bottle, poured at RIFT Weizenbock calibration tasting. Rich, pale goodness. This was probably my favorite of the whole night. Ayinger does these stronger wheats really well, obviously. This one is no exception, with tawny fruits and lots of complexity. Comforting, unique and enjoyable. It does have a feel of being a double wheat, but without the yeasts getting overbearing, which I feel can happen in stronger examples of wheat beers.

Bready, yeasty aroma, wheat malts and banana.  Pours a hazy straw/golden color, massive white head with great retention, good lacing.  Big wheat/bread flavor, fruity, banana, light spicy hops, great malt profile, alcohol is well hidden.  Medium body, high carbonation.  Delicious and easy to drink, another great beer from Ayinger.

500ml bottle.  Nose is intense.  Some spices, cloves, bananas, candy. With a yeast bread undertone.  Pour is a translucent hazy yellow - almost glowing with a quickly fading white head.  Taste is well balanced,hard to pick dominant flavor.  Some bread, fruit, malt, and candy. Lingering finish with just a little bitterness to counterbalance.  Well structured beer.  Can see why its so highly rated.
This beer was quite malty and bready with some yeast. Some banana notes in the nose and in the flavor. I remember it had a decent sized head.

Pours hazed orange, lighter than expected, with a medium sized foamy white head. Aroma of bread and fruit, some gum, spicy and citrusy yeast, the nutty maltiness of the bock also comes through. Taste is surprisingly light and citrusy with less sweet nutty malt than expected. This beer is incredibly easy to drink, I cant believe Im just now rating it because Im sure Ive had it several times before.

Bottle in weizen glass. Nice foamy head - disappears fairly quickly. Aroma of wheat, grass, and nuts. Colour is a cloudy orange. Wonderful wheaty sweet and little sour taste. Soft, creamy, a little oily in the mouth. A nice beer.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a nice unclear gold color with a nice, foamy white three inch head that lasts.  Taste is of malt, honey, wheat, yeast, caramel, spice and a touch of warming alcohol.  Similar aroma.  Has a great chewy body that coats the mouth.  Very drinkable considering the alcohol and very satisfying.  A great beer to kick off the fall and winter months.

bottle in a half-liter mug - OK, so I messed up the pour, so I can only assume what the end product would have looked like.  Regardless, it looks awesome - a honey colored pour with lots of white head, but leaving no lacing.   Aroma is banana and more malty goodness.  Taste is sweet.  Overall, a good beer, unoffensive and tasty.
Pours a brownish tinged yellow with 2 fingers of white foam. Definite estery notes on the nose. The banana on the tongue is fused with some malty elements. Finishes clean. Solid!
Cloudy, golden, massive whip cream like head; earthy and spicy aromas; rough, grainy texture; strong banana flavors; alcohol well hidden; delicious.
Bottle. Color cloudy yellow with medium head. Aroma citrus, banana, spicy, sweet. Taste spicy, citrus, yeast, wheat.

33 cl bottle, BBE 06/2009. Rated on 5.12.2008
Aroma has a lot of banana, some citrus and wheat. Flavour is also filled with banana esthers, but also citrus and hints of spices do appear. Flavour is actually less sweet than aroma. Something between hefeweizen and weizen bock. Around 06/2009 this was not that good, there was a clear cardboard aroma in the flavour.
500ml bottle. Clear yellow color, big foamy white head. Nice, spicy banana aroma, carbonation is a bit sharp.

A lot of banana and citrus in the aroma.  Pours cloudy gold with a thick head.  Taste is lighter and sweeter than I expected, with some citrus and spice.  This isnt the best beer that Ayinger puts out, but still a fine effort.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2012 OK, its Weizenbock. Its good as hell. Still, not good enough. Aventinus and Weihenstephaner are better. This one has a too light taste for a weizenbock. Nonetheless, a solid choice.

Rerating 25.1.2012:
Smell of overripe fruit. Cloudy peach colour. Citric aroma, slight sweetness.
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 28.11.2009. Good weizen bock, reminds me of Aventinus. Notes of yeast, malts and fruits.

In short: A corpulent spicy (clove mainly) banana bread in a bottle.  Very nice
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed probably fresh a few weeks after purchase.
The look: Cloudy dirty blonde body topped by a medium white head with medium retention
In long: Nose is full of fresh bananas, banana bread, cloves and light notes of corianger.  Body is full and satisfying, plenty of crisp wheat, yeast, plenty of semi-ripe bananas, some honey, a lemon zest, .  Just has nourishing as it is refreshing.  The intrinsic spiciness of the beer helps to make the beer somewhat dry but I would have even preferred it with a little less cloves flavor.  Another great beer from this classic german brewery that has been brewing quality beers since the late 1800s.  Must have been a lot of work to rate beers back then, I mean writing your ratings on a tiny piece of paper and sending them via messenger pigeon to the ratebeer garrison.
Bottle from Super Brugsen Højby. Hazy orange colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, citrus, spice, banana, caramel, malt and wheat.

Bottle from Maruhn, DarmstadtCloudy blond color; medium-sized compact head. Nice aroma of wheat and banana. The mouthfeel is drier than expected, with too high carbonation, leading to a rather weak final; the flavor is mild, with some wheat, very light spicy touch, and probably a fermentation off-flavor that turns almost into sweet liquorice. Low bitterness. Not exciting.

large bottle - pours a hazy deep yellow color with medium sized fluffy white head. Aroma has fair amount of banana and light caramel, honey, bit grainy,  touch of lemon zest and mint leaves. Flavor is fairly malty, with light caramel, lemon, banana, touch of oak. Finish is mildly sweet. This is alright but not amazing. It seems like the corollary of a blond bock - a blond weizenbock. Somehow it offends my sensibilities. A bock (weizen or otherwise) in my mind is dark, not pale. Oh well, not something that I will be reaching for again.

pours very hazy orange with a thin white head and lots of cloudy yeast.  aroma is bananas and citrus.  Taste is generally sweet with bubble gum, orange peel, and yeast notes.  finish is dry and slightly tart.  A nice weizen, certainly true to style.  Overall very well balanced but not overwhelming in any way.

The beer that started it all for me.  Prior to drinking this I didnt really know what good beer was.   Smooth amazingly drinkable 7.1% beer.  Aroma of cloves and doughy sweetness.  Palate is smooth and crisp.  Tastes perfect for the style of clove, banana, earthy sweetness and light citrus.

A really good Weizen. Some good spice, pepper, toast and hop.

Well Done!

Sampled at Texas Beerfest. Pours a cloudy orange with a frothy white head that leaves good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is Belgian yeast and clove. Medium mouthfeel with a sweet malt and clove. Easy to drink hiding the alcohol well, a good weizenbock from Ayinger.

From the 25 fl. oz. bottle.  The pour is an extremely heady hazy, pale yellow delicate carbonation bubbles.  The head really lingers.  Aroma of malty esters.  The body medium and creamy.  The taste is also solid on the malts with an almost tart finish.

500mL into an Aventinus glass. The pour is a dirty, clear gold with a fizzy, tannish head that grows and dies in about ten seconds. No lace. Nose is candy corn. Taste is husky and grainy with sickly sweet old candies and mild vinegar. Soapy and watery palate. Probably an old bottle or poorly stored bottle. Gross.

Robuster hefenelkiger Geruch mit einer dezent rauchigen Note. Hefiger Start. Danach nelkig und süß-aromatisch, Ananasaromen. Gleichwohl auch nussige Momente. Sahnig und hefig abklingend. 
Ein guter Weizenbock.
Hazy and stiff liquid with yellowish head. Very exciting aroma of sweet, garainy notes and bitter floral ones. Real weissbier taste but more powerful and intensive, I liked it very much.

Dark yellow, good head.  That clove and banana comes through in the nose.  A good bit of spice in the flavor with the finish lingering in the spices while hiding the alcohol well.  Ive decided that Ayinger cranks out some really good brews.

(bottle). Cloudy straw color. Medium off white head. Moderate bready aroma, with light banana. Sweet bready flavor, with light alcohol. Avg duration. Light alcohol finish. Light slick/creamy texture. Moderate to high carbonation. Medium body.

Süßer, etwas alkoholischer Antrunk mit deutlicher Bananennote. Fruchtig-milder Mittelteil, der konstant bleibt. Das Bananenaroma nimmt zum Abgang etwas ab, die Alkoholnote nimmt leicht zu. 
Danke an Auxburg1986. 	 
Test vom 25.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,10,9,10,13,10

Served in a Russian River Sound Czech pilsner glass.

Pours a very cloudy light golden color with a dense white head that sticks around for a bit. Some spotty lacing on the sides of the glass and a thick collar throughout. The nose is filled with clove, alcohol, and a strong bready presence. The flavor scales back on the bread and picks up more clove along with a bit of banana. Booze there as well. Body is medium with moderate carbonation. Pretty good, though nothing Id go out of my way for again; nowhere near Celebrator.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-02-2011

Bottled 330ml. -Murky apricot coloured, medium sized white head, yeasty fruity nose. Moderate malty, quite yeasty and fruity (banana) with notes of spices and odd hint of smoke. Lack of alcohol or well hidden Im not sure. All in all pleasant weizen bock.

Hazy, almost cloudy, orange/gold with a bright white head and nice lacing. Aromas of wheat and banana with a touch of citrus. Flavors are similar, but the banana comes through a bit stronger. Wonderful pillowy soft mouthfeel accompanied by generous carbonation.

500 ml bottle purchased a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($4.79).  Pours a burnt sunset orange with three fingers of fluffy off-white foam that only slowly dissipates...a lovely beer (though perhaps light in color for the style).  Aroma of caramel, toasted wheat bread, banana, grape, yeast, light citrus, and light spice.  Flavor includes much the same as found in the nose: bready malts, light caramel, banana, yeast, tingling spice.  Only slightly sweet.  Great carbonation.  A very solid brew.  (311, 526)
Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with fluffy white head.  Aroma is sweet wheat with notes of bread, caramel, citrus, and banana.  Palate is thick and smooth.  Taste is sweet, finishing dry.
Thick, yellowish head. Cloudy, golden yellow in appearance, beautiful. Aroma is primarily yeasty. The taste is light, with an alcoholic aftertaste. Rather fizzy. Definitely one that will warm you up.
Cloudy orange with a small white head.  Aroma of banana and citrus.  Taste is of sweet malt and caramel.  Finish is a soft bitterness to perfectly balance.  A marvelous brew.
Looove me some ayinger. This has a nice sweet taste to it. Great overall beer

Bottle. Pours a hazy glowing orange with a small creamy white head. Aroma is nicely soft with the banana, light fruits, hint of clove and other spiciness, over a soft bready wheat note. Flavor is very smooth, soft and easy drinking. Plenty of creamy fruitiness with the banana and a touch of citrus with a nice rich caramel and wheat backbone. Medium body and a soft carbonation. Really nice beer.

Bottle, Liquor World, Fayetteville. Hazy copper with a noisy layer of white foam. Cream and vanilla nose with a bit of clove and plums. Cinnamon and sort of heavy dried fruit sweetness. Very soft with no prickly bits at all. But I wish for some kind of edge to cut through and offer a bit of relief from the sweet. Lots of flavor and character, but gets too sticky for my palate pretty quickly.

Lightly hazed gold. Copious creamy white head.  Fluffy and expansive carbonation. Pleasant nose of mint, banana taffy, bubblegum, chalk, plasticlike phenols, clove, plaster, and baked apples. Firmly mineralic and sweetly malty with a sound honey-drizzled cracker foundation. Floral hop notes link up with faint clove and sweet bubblegum and curb the starchy wheat. Banana profile isnt overly vibrant, and the chalky yeast and plastic notes prolong the dullness. Fermented-wheat fruitiness harmonizes with a baked apple twang. Closes sufficiently sassy yet somewhat dull with a pear, putty, and mashed banana mixture. No discernible flaws, but could benefit from more vibrancy. Pretty good.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle. Semi-hazy golden darker orange color with a finger of pure white head.  Grapefruit, banana, caramel, clove and spice in the aroma.  Light banana, some breadiness, slightly sweet in the middle, and a hint of citrus.  Creamiery body with soft carbonation, mediumish overall.  Nice brew, and pretty tasty.

500 ml bottle from The Royale. Pours a cloudy gold color with a huge, foamy, eggshell white head. Aroma of banana, clove, sweet and pale malts, wheat, pepper, and leaves. Flavor of banana, clove, sweet bready malts, straw, wheat, sugar, and lemongrass. Medium-bodied, with a lot of soft carbonation and a bready, malty mouthfeel and somewhat spicy finish. Really nice balance and goes down so easily.
Bottle.  Dark cloudy yellow with rich white pillow head. Aroma of alcohol, banana and Orange sherbert.  Rich flavour.  Banana lemon and strong alcohol. A bit of sugar cookie as well.

Poured out a cloudy dirty yellow gold brew with a large foamy white cap that dies quickly and leaves almost no lacing. Wonderful spicy aroma with cloves, bananas, warm pineapple juice, a bit of dankness, wheat.. very nice. The taste is also very good.. exceptionaly even. Cloves, weak bananas, wheat, something that is not chocolate, light lemon.. just goodness and fullness. Heavily softly carbonated, leaves a nice reminder coating in my mouth, lots of clovey spice lingerings and strength. Excellent beer!

Bottle. Deep honey golden, densely hazy, magnificent eternal meringue of a head. This is about as pretty as a weizen can be! Aroma of soft banana and sweet spices, hints of vanilla cookie. Beautiful flavours of caramelized banana, silky wheat, sweet spices. Mouthfeel is creamy smooth, luxurious.  The best weizen (bock or otherwise) that Ive had in a while.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: From the pour I got a tall three to four finger head of slow fading stiff foam over a cloudy flat tan/orange colored liquid. Lots of visible carbonation flows up to the head which also makes lots of slick lace patterns on the glass.

Smell: The nose is full of estery, fruity and bready yeast notes.

Taste/Palate: The flavor has loads of tasty wheat character. There is a semi-sweet mix of bread malt, tart wheat and hops with a twist of lemon and green banana peel. The finish leans more to the dry side with a very mild hop presence. Its palate feels lively and well carbonated with a firm medium body.

Notes: This is a lovely showcase of deep wheaty flavor.

(500ml bottle).  Pours hazy yellow with white head and very active carbonation.  Aroma has some banana, butter, alcohol, and something vegetal.  Taste is mostly sweet, but pleasant.  Medium bodied with a creamy texture.  Finish is very smooth and alcohol is noticeable as your chest warms.  This is a really nice and highly drinkable beer.

The aroma is great with banana, cloves, bubble gum, and wheat. The appearance is cloudy orange gold with a large foamy head. The taste is like the aroma with a slightly bitter finish. The palate is quite thin. Overall a great beer but doesnt quite seem to be a bock in style but then again maybe the alcohol is just well hidden.

12oz bottle shared by MartinT.
Appearance : Semi clear yellow with a small head.

Aroma : Great banana bread with nice spices. Light notes of rubber.

Taste : Nice bananas and spices. Bready malt. Nice wheat on finish. A little bit mineral. 

Overall : Nice nose and taste. Felt a little bit old maybe. Great stuff still.

Got some of this from the. original import shipment, it seems like it is a Winter seasonal now judging by the label art. 7.1% alcohol, Im expecting a REA imperial Hefeweizen.

Pours into my non branded weizen glass with a huge white head. The head is kind of watery and doesnt for the big mounds of fluff like most weizens do. No lacing whatsoever. The beer is a hazy goldish with hints of orange Hefeweizen color with golden edges.

Smells pretty damn good for this style. You get the typical Hefeweizen notes like banana, wheat, and clove but with an infusion of black licorice and some other spice perhaps. You can even pick up the alcohol in the scent.

The taste is heavier and sweeter than a normal Hefeweizen. Has some lemon, clove, and banana in the taste along wiht osme creamy vanilla and black licorice in the finish. The yeast adds a nice tang to it aswell.

The carbonation is prickly and active, but not over the top, lending to a fair drinkability. The alcohol becomes more apparent as you go.

This is a great wheat beer for the Winter, proves you can have it year round for all those naysayers out there.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-02-2009 01:53:22
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 This is quite good. Strong banana-y flavor and aroma. Warming and yeasty flavor. Serving: Bottle

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 My Bottom Line:
Heavy banana wheat bread flavors build this Weizenbocks thick signature, while alcohol and clove-y phenolics add depth. 

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam covers the dark, cloudy golden.
-The soft, natural carbonation is not able to alleviate the relative heft of the mouthfeel.
-The cereal sweetness is honeyed at times.
-This is one expressive yeast, folks.
-This is a good, hearty Weizenbock, but Id prefer better attenuation myself.

Bottles.

From bottle. Wheaty and bready with a little bit of sour funk and dusty character, mushroomy. Yeasty and sweet with light orange and brown sugar. Golden amber hazy with thin white lacing head. Medium bodied with medium carbonation, smooth with light warming. Starts sweet with banana, orange, brown sugar, and wheat. Yeasty esters and mild citrus tang, light bitterness at the finish. Coriander and bubblegum. Nice weizen bock.
This is probably my favorite beer.  It packs a lot of flavor and goes well with any non spicy dish.  It comes at a price though as each bottle with burn you for 5 bucks.

Bright golden with beautiful bountiful head.  Bursting clove and banana come wifting off the top for to smell with a nice brandy burn to inhale.  The body is medicinally viscous with a light sparkle that doesnt quite offset its syrupyness, yet is still quite dexterous.  A nice herby quality adds to the abundant spice and lingering sweetened palate cleansing sparkle.  A touch of citrus leaves with a nice example of the style but falls short of what it could be.  Still good though.
Not really groundbreaking among weizenbocks but still a great German beer in its own right with that just right funky yeast flavor.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with fizzy white head that subsides quickly and fairly aggressive carbonation. Aroma of banana, wheat, spice, and the slightest of citrus. Flavor is spicy sweet and finishes with that banana characteristic.  Palate is tingly with strong carbonation and thicker than your average wheat beer while still being very crisp with a wonderfully sweet and spicy finish.

Bottle. Nice cloudy yellow pour with a pillowy head. Aromas full of fruits. Banana, apple, orange and pear off the top. Taste is clean and refreshing. Lots of wheat and more soft fruit. Body is well balanced. Carbonation level is right on as well.

Pours from the 16.9 oz. bottle a cloudy, hazy yellow with a giant 2 1/2 finger head that stays for quite a while.  Very active carbonation...tons and tons of bubbles rising in the murky haze.  Aroma is of banana , lemon, and perhaps a little orange, with a hint of spice (coriander?) as well.  1st sip is an amazingly delicious blend of the banana and citrus, with a soft, sweet, almost candy-like undertone.  The classic wheat malt crispness shines through.  Mouthfeel is soft and full with a nice sparkle from the carbonation. Drinkability is almost TOO good for a beer with that packs a 7.1% abv punch.  These would be such a treat on a hot summer day, although it hits the spot here in January, too.  Overall, a very tasty and satisfying beer!  Ill be picking up more of this soon and letting some age for summertime!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2012 Bottle @ home. Golden yellow orange appearance with small off white head. Wheat and bock nose with a fairly strong smell with a bit of citrus. Wheat flavor initially with a wine-like quality that is really the bock flavor. Sweet and alcohol fueled finish. Pretty well carbonated. Pretty good weizenbock.

Pours a hazy, deep golden with moderate head.  Nice, flavorful wheaty aroma with spice.  Very well-balanced taste - smooth, flavorful and just a very good weizen bock.  Cant go wrong with Ayinger - Prost!

.5L bottle. May have been served a little too cold. Poured a rich yellow with fluffy, loose, head and excellent retention. Typical weizen aroma. Full-bodied and very smooth. Sweet crisp lager taste with smooth weizen notes: this tastes like an excellent helles and an excellent weizen combined. Almost too sweet for me, but not quite. Excellent!
Bottle from pikapp327.  Hazy orange pour with a nice white head.  Aroma is coriander, yeast, and lots of banana.  Taste is orange, spice, lemon zest, and lots of yeast.

Bottle courtesy pikapp327. Hazy ruddy orange color with a white foamy head. Aroma is yeasty bread with lots of clove and banana. Flavor is lots of banana, sweet clove and even sweeter grains. Finishes fairly clean with some lingering fruit characteristics. Sounds like you need a Han Job!

Bottle... Hazy yellow ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Great retention. The aroma is chock full of banana, clove, pink bubblegum and pear. Medium-bodied with modest carbonation. The flavor is sweet, spicy and fruity with a doughy tea biscuit component. Sweet, doughy finish.

New Beer Distributors 500ml ($5): Pours a cloudy yellowish body (like a dirty blonde) with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and citrus (lemon methinks). Taste has some sour notes from the lemon citrus notes. Spicy throughout. Alcohol covered. Kind of sweet as well. Kind of seems like two hefes pushed together. I knew what I was getting into and it delivered exactly that.
17oz bottle-pours orange with a white head.  Aroma is banana/clove, sweet light/medium malt/wheat.  Taste follows with 2nd spice hops.  Medium body.

(bottle) pours a murky deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of grainy wheat, slightly sour, with light notes of spicy fruit cake and vanilla. flavour is mostly the same, with a more pronounced banana profile and a medium sweetness. medium to heavy body with lively carbonation.
Bottle.Hazy orange colour with large white head.Aroma of wheat and fruits peach apricot and banana heavy alc but crispy nice and well balanced.
Bottle.  Hazy straw color with a small white head.  Aroma of bubble gum and banana.  A hint of what might be nutmeg in there as well.  Taste is bubble gum, honey, and clove.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle from Valley Farm. Very hazy orange/yellow color on the pour. Sizable foam. Slightly sweet aroma. Lots of yeast and spices. Yeasty flavors. Somewhat dry. Alot of spice. Fairly straightforward, yet solid example of the style.

Hmm, nem tudom hová tenni ezt a sört, az biztos, hogy kissé más, mint az eddig kóstolt búzabakjaim, de az is, hogy nagyon finom! Narancssárga szín, nem túl nagy és egyáltalán nem hosszú életű piszkosfehér hab. Az illata banános, élesztős és kissé fűszeres, valamint alkoholos. Ugyanezek a jegyek lelhetőek fel ízében is, főleg az érett banán és a szolid fűszeresség dominál, megspékelve egy kis pikáns mandarinnal. Az utóíze száraz, kissé alkoholos és édeskés, szépen végigíveli a történetet a búzamaláta zamata. Nekem nagyon bejött!

An unusual Weizenbock. Pours a very light (used to the darker weizenbocks) hazy orange with a super long lasting foamy white head. Nose is clovey with a good bit of banana and a superior bready malt crispness that I have come to expect from Ayinger.  Intense clove and spice complement the really superior malt background. Almost like a double strength version of their exceptional Hefe. This is an absolutely amazing german beer. Simple yet refined.

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured murky, with a golden yellow color and a small, off-white, quick to disappear head. Yeast, spices, honey, apple, caramel and banana in the aroma. Sugary sweetness in a medium body and low carbonation. Really nice one.

04-12-10: Bière trouble, avec une belle couleur orangée et des reflets jaune/dorée. Mousse blanche, riche et abondante, très effervescente. Aromes de bananes, de bubble gum avec des notes de sucré et de dautres fruits, tel peches et poires. En bouche, elle est soyeuse et a une belle onctuosité. Elle offre des saveurs de bananes et dépices (girofle, gimgembre), ainsi que de bubble gum. Toute petite amertume en finale, mais très bien balancée. Notes de sucrée également présentes.

Bottle. Poured hazy golden orange colour with a generous white head. Aroma is lots of fruits, peaches, banana and sweet wheat. Flavour is banana, wheat, some sweetness and spices as well. Very enjoyable beer.

Édes-fanyar karakterű búzabak főzet ködös, narancsos színnel, tetején egy közepes méretű piszkosfehér habbal, mely vékonyan megmarad.
Illata érett banánt idéz, melyet enyhe fűszeresség kísér.
Fanyar, de alapvetően édes, malátás aromája citrus-gyümölcsös, gabonás és finoman szegfűszeges, íze banánturmix jellegű.
Fanyar-édeskés befejezésében feltűnik a bors, a szegfűszeg, a citrus gyümölcsös savasság és az alkohol is kellemesen melenget, amely végül egy fanyar-édes-fűszer íz-egyveleget hagy maga után.
Teste sima és krémes, betölti a szájat, viszont a komló keserűségét alig-alig éreztem.
Ettől függetlenül, és mindent összevetve jófajta és finom egy darab, annyi szent.

Aroma is dry, spicy malt, buttery and sweet. Sugar and caramel, biscuits and butterscotch. Earthy: really nice.

The appearance is cloudy golden yellow. Healthy white head. 

Flavor is sweet, buttery caramel malts. Spicy wheat accent. Biscuits and shortbreads. Toffee and German malts. Musty horseblanket (appropriately so). Starts sweetly and then finishes with a hint of bubblegum.

The palate is creamy and with a bouncy fizz. A funky lil number; sweet and with and earthy finish. Really balanced and good.
(bottle) gold with quickly fading head. Aroma of clove and sweet malts. Flavor is sweet malty, clove, some banana and light fruit, yeast.

Csak a hjó sör, Budapest
Opálos, érett mandarin színű söröcske, amin egy bézsszínű, rendkívül krémes  és közepes méretű hab trónol, ami szinte sohasem akar teljesen eltűnni. Illatában a túlérett banánt, rengeteg malátát és karamellízált mézet érezni, sok élesztővel és valami kis állati beütéssel. Az ízében még uralkodóbban jön elő a gyümölcskavalkád, méz és a banán, ahhoz hasonlóan, mint amikor mézben és fűszerekben hempergetett banánt sütünk. Szegfűszeg, koriander, fahéj és fehér bors, amit szerintem érezni lehet a fűszerek között és a komló gyantája is megjelenik a végjátékban. Elég sűrű, testes és szépen él, mozog és pezseg. Utóíze karamellás, gyümölcsös, keserédes. Fantasztikusan finom, összetett és nemes egy ital, ünnepekre való búzabak.

0,33 l bottle, Csakajosor, Budapest.
Murky, orange-peach-reddish colored beer with a delicious white pillowy, stable off white head. Complex aroma with tropical fruits, caramel and malt, phenolic banana, spicies, alcohol. Thick body, smooth mouthfeel with a tons of overriped fruits(banana, lichy, citrusses), fine spicies like clove and cinnamon, malt and some alcohol that warms me up. Fine!

500 ml Bottle. Pours lightly hazy gold with a large, creamy-frothy white head, good retention with good lacing. Aroma is huge banana esters with caramel,HUGE citrus, light yeast and biscuit malt. Light citrus hops and a warm, near fuzzy alcohol character as it warms. Flavor is very similar to this Brewers Hefe but with a slightly drier finish. The higher ABV is noticeable after a few bottles.  I will buy this anytime I can find it.

Very good beer. Pours a hazy straw color with a big soapy head. The aroma is sweet and spicy. The flavor is sweet and dry. with a peppery mouth feel. Very nice warming as it warms. No trace of the alcohol. Very nice.

Bottle picked up In Germany June 2010 (probably Bavaria) consumed on Lozs birthday 14th Nov 2010   Its getting towards the end of the night and Ive had a few today, my ratings reads thus Bit like ice cream on first taste, some pineapple, soft in mouth, hazy orange with a white head  Sorry I could be no more descriptive, but it appeared I liked it.   A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov14  3.5

Very hazy, toasty orange color with a small head that retains very well. Big wheat and yeast aroma. Lots of banana, clove, bubblegum, wheat, and a bit of citrus. Sweet flavor with creamy mouthfeel. Nice finish on this one.

500 ml bottle from Country Club Liquors. Nose is banana, yeast, wheaty bread, and caramel. Cloudy orange with a medium yellow tinged head. Flavor is fruity banana, white pepperiness, yeast, and some bubblegum. Pretty good stuff.

500ml bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow with a thick fluffy head fairly light color for a weizenbock. The aroma consists of bread, cereal, toast, dough, and a little caramel. The taste is moderately sweet with little other tastes and a very lively mouthfeel. Surprisingly similar to a hefeweizen in appearance and aroma yet stronger in alcohol content.

Aroma of honey, cherries, orange peel and banana. Appearance is opaque gold with foamy white head. Flavor matches the nose with a sweet caramel malt backbone. Palate is creamy and effervescent. Another spot-on beer from Ayinger.

A: The pour is a slightly cloudy, bright orange color with a big white head that eventually settles down a fingers worth.

S: Lots of sweetness and fruitiness on the nose, which are quite pleasant. Sweet malt and wheat with some ripe apples, pears, and citrus. A touch of spicy esters as well.

T: Moderately sweet with the same clean malt and wheat character. Sweet oranges, apples, and pears are there again as well. The clove spice character is present, but somewhat subdued.

M: The body is medium with a full and rolling carbonation that fills the mouth.

D: Not a problem at all to drink the half liter bottle of this one. Maybe not quite as good as some of the other weizenbocks Ive had, but still quite quaffable.

500mL bottle pours hazy golden/straw with thick white bubbly head. Aroma is wheat, banana, clove, and coriander . Nice bubble gum flavor right away followed by banana, wheat and spices. Not really a wheat beer fan but this is a nice one.
Finally, my 10th weizenbock!  10/2/10.  Bottle.  Extremely light color for the style... Huge sweet banana aroma and flavor... missing something.  Meh.
Bottle. Hazy dark gold pour  with a thin white head. Banana, bubble gum aroma. Smooth crisp malt with great banana and bubble gum in the finish. Decent brew.

[Bottle] Pours a cloudy dark golden color with a nice cap of white head. Nose of cinnamon, banana, yeast and of some vanilla. Clove, spices, lots of wheat, fruity esters and nutmeg in the taste. The palate is creamy, full bodied and a touch sticky. No alcoholic touches like many others in the style. Very nicely balanced and well made.

Notes from Thursday, September 23, 2010
16.9 oz. bottle from Johns Grocery Iowa City, $2.50

Ar: Huge banana and clove/spice aroma.
Ap: Pours a hazy light copper-straw with a huge pillowy weizen head.  Doesnt leave a lot of lace.
T: Very nice.  Everything I could ask for in a wheat.  Its got a huge banana backbone with a nice spice (clove, cinnamon) kick.
P: Big, chewy, thick body.

Great weizen-bock.

330 ml bottle. Rated @ 13.11.2009.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is classic Weizen Bock style; banana, fruits, malt and wheat in a decent balance. Flavour is medium sweet with banana and wheat dominating the taste. Medium bodied, oily to slicky mouthfeel with decent carbonation. Nice brew all-in-all.

Bottle.  Pours a very very murky yellowish orange--probably the Whole Foods baggers fault for tossing the bottle in my bag horizontally.  Big bubbly white head, not much lace.  The aroma is very spicy with hints of clove and bananas and even some vanilla--like a traditional hefe.  The flavor is pretty much the same.  I don;t normally like hefes or wheats, but this beer is damn tasty and refreshing.  Not overly spicy and astringent like many.  Smooth and easy going.  Medium to light body with medium carbonation.  Overall: a standout beer in its category.
Bottle on 09/12/2010. Hazy orange body with a large frothy white head. Sweet banana and clove aroma. Very sweet banana, clove and bready flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
Foggy Amber, thin white head.  Aroma is lightly yeasty, citrus, very heavy on orange peel.  Taste is citrus, yeast- very forward beer.

Savannah, Ga. - Habersham Beverages - 500 ml. bottle. Dark orange pour, sticky off-white head. Nice bubble gum and clove aroma. Flavor had the requisite banana and bubble gum without being too sweet or cloying. Thick, sticky mouthfeel.

A solid pour nets me a fluffy, four-finger thick head in my 25cl tulip glass that is a pale tan color.  The beer is a murky looking gold / amber color that shows  a deeply hazed, bright orange / straw color when held up to the light.  I wasnt expecting a Helles Weizen Bock, but I am quite happy to see one.  As I am pouring this characteristic aromas of clove and banana are quite noticeable.  A more focused inspection of the nose yields lots of banana backed by spicy clove notes in the finish as well as a touch of white pepper.  Underneath are aromas of grassy grain, a rustic grain character that reminds me of fresh crushed wheat, perhaps a touch of fruity apple notes.  This has a nice, characteristic aroma that I am definitely digging.

Somewhat dry tasting, at least I was expecting more sweetness in a Bock version, though there is a hint of complex wheat sweetness that is a suggestion towards the finish.  There is a nice bite to the finish that is a combination of spicy yeast character, hop bitterness and a carbonic bite.  This has a really nice grain flavor to it, chewy, rustic, a bit hay-like and lightly tart in its wheat character.  Soft flavors of banana, and perhaps even some sweet / tart green apple are noticeable here.  This has a nice lush texture to it, chewy, almost toothsome at times; I have had normal strength Hefes with this texture, but this is a bit chewy compared to most normal strength versions.  This beer is so drinkable though, my first pour of this disappears way faster than I was expecting it to.

This is a very tasty beer; it really hides its strength quite well, which is certainly dangerous in a 7.1% beer.  I really like how vibrant the traditional Hefeweizen character is here; it definitely seems like the character volume has been turned up a bit, which is really then only, subtle, sign that this is not a traditional strength Hefewiezen.  Very tasty and one that I am definitely enjoying, this must be an absolutely killer beer when it is fresh.

500ml bottle. Poured a slight golden orange color with a medium sized, foamy white head. Aroma is orange, malts, yeast. Flavor was pretty full bodied, caramel, orange rind, banana, cloves, yeast. Creamy, finish was pretty clean, bit of lingering yeast and bananas remain. Solid weizen.

500 ml. bottle- Pours cloudy golden with a thin white head, lots of carbonation bubbles, the glass might have something to do with the small head, I poured it int a dimpeled mug, but I wish I would have poured it into my wheat glass. Aroma is wheat and bananas with some yeast. The flavor is banana esters and wheat, a pretty standard German wheat beer, standard not being a bad word. Its creamy, un-filtered, full bodied high carbonation like a good wheat beer should be. No off notes makes it a great German wheat beer.

Bottle: Pours a dark golden, with a fluffy white head. Has the smell and flavor characteristics of your typical german wheat; banana, clove, citrus, with a spiciness. Medium Bodied feel, this brew did not exactly blow me away.
