Bottle from Kenny Road Market, poured into weizen glass. Hazy golden pour with a fluffy head. Aromas of clove, banana, and barnyard with flavors to match, though the spiciness is really accentuated on the tongue. Oily mouthfeel. Pretty good.

Bottle.  Pours lightly hazy gold with a large, creamy-frothy white head, good retention with good lacing.  Aroma is huge banana esters with caramel and vanilla nose, light bread and biscuit malt.  Light citrus hops and a warm, near fusel alcohol character as it warms.  Flavor is alcohol to start with moderate caramel malt, sweet toast and biscuit notes and a light hop bitterness.  Banana esters and a dry finish.  Medium bodied, medium-high carbonation.

500ml bottle from K&L.  Pours a hazy yellowish-orange color that magically transforms to a clear golden as it sits.  A well-formed white head sits on top and leaves some lacing.  The aroma is excellent for a weizenbock.  Really big yeasty notes of banana, clove, and bubblegum.  The flavor has slightly sweet wheat malt, big banana esters, and spicy cloves.  Just a tiny acrid note to detract, but its barely noticeable.  The mouthfeel is great - medium-bodied with a good level of carbonation for this style.  Great for the style overall, as I expect to get from Ayinger.
this one did not knock my socks off. banana, clove, sweet, whatever. you know the drill. what do i know know about weizen-bocks? nothing. youd be better off reading the next guys review.

Bottle 33 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Misty blonde orangy color with a beautiful white head. Nose of citrus-fruits, orange, yeast and spices. The taste is unctuous, fruity, spicy clove, nutmeg, coriander, touch of rose water. The palate is fresh and lively, lemon, banana, apple, shades of chewing gum.

2010-07-01. Crisp dark yellow body, small white head. 3+ Flavour is pleasant, modest estery character, pleasant fruit and wheat, little or no alcohol presence. 7+ Modest wheaty aroma, light pale malts, mild esters. 6+ Average palate is lightly carbonated. Enjoyable, and a very nice change of pace from the heavier brews we had been sampling. Bottle at Seattle International Beer Festival

[3073-20100702] Sample. Light banana wheat yeast aroma. Slightly hazy, pale orange yellow body with a quick foamy white head. More banana wheat yeast flavour has a long floral potpourri finish. Medium body. Nice break from our other samples but not super interesting.
(@ SIB 2010, Seattle, WA)
Bottle.  Yellow pour with a massive frothy white head.  Aroma of wheat and lemons.  Great medium bodied taste of wheat, cloves, citrus and bread with a lasting slightly sweet finish.

Basically your standard wheat aroma, bit heavier on the banana over the clove, fairly light. Thin white head disappeared almost immediately leaving no trace. Cloudy orange brown in color, murky even. Fairly sweet with some spice and banana coming through at the end. Very thin feel and little carbonation. Disappointing to a degree which makes me think something was wrong with my bottle. Ive come to expect much more from Ayinger so Ill reevaluate another bottle.
Bottle sampled at SIB, pours amber orange. Aroma of banana, clove and wheat. Flavour of banana, clove, citrus, wheat and spices. Excellent.

500ml bottle - BevMo

Aroma - suprisingly fruity, solid wheat base...reminds me of fruit cocktail.

Appearance - cloudy golden orange body, 2" white rocky head, great retention

Taste - caramel, cloves, banana, light citrus zest, really nice

Palate - it defines smoothness and velvet/creamy texture.  Carbonation melds perfectly.

Overall - world class greatness here, really a great price too

Bottle pours a very hazy golden body with a tall vanilla head. Nice retention with lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is mostly clove and overripe banana, but bready wheat and clover honey notes are picked up underneath. Creamy medium body has an ideal carbonation. Taste mirrors the aroma. Clove and ripe banana, accented by a lemony zing, yeast, and sweet bready malts. Subtle hops add a spicy/earthy bitterness. Excellent all around.
Enjoyable beer.  Good head, strong taste, solid head.  Its a rather strong beer so enjoy slowly.

Appearance: Brown, cloudy, unfiltered
Aroma:  Banana and cloves, not too strong. (But I have a weak sense of smell.)
Palate: Typical wheat beer texture, soft feel with medium weight.
Flavor: Fruit(Banana)-spice-malt-and hops can all be detected, higher alcohol content (7.1%) is well hidden. Hop flavor is detectable but low.
Overall:  Great wheat beer. Very similar to German Hefe-Wizens which is my favorite style and this fits in very nicely. The higher alcohol contentment isnt noticeable in the taste. Ive tried this several times; sometimes the malt flavor is stronger and the banana flavor is less whereas other time the banana flavor is stronger and the malt flavor is less.

solid overall; but nothing special;  lots of flavors/aromas but not much really stood out.  I also had an odd taste at the end that I am not sure of; would be a good thirst quencher on hot day but wont go out of my way to try again..

Bottle. Poured an cloudy yellow color with an average creamy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate banana, wheat and clove aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

Pours a completely clouded yellow gold into the glass with a large white head.  Aroma is bready with banana and clove esters.  Flavor has a bit of bubblegum flavor as well as a very low amount of alcohol coming through for a 7.1% beer.  Good beer, would like to try it fresh.

"Banana, apricot, flowers, yeast, soap, and spices are all detected within the fine aroma (although the soap is a little weird). Golden orange cloudy body with a big white head and frothy lacing. Dry with a boozy kick and a medium malt body. Crisp wheat, banana and pear along with apple fritters and cloves. A sturdy brew."

33cl Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Cloudy yellow orange colour, dense creamy white head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, yeast, as it warms some sharp alcohol as well. Flavour is sweet, fruity, banana and pear, lots of yeast, some chemical plastic-like note (probably from the yeast), bittersweet finish with some alcohol. Medium bodied. This one is not on top form I guess.

Pours a hazy deep gold. Impressive white head that leaves lacing throughout.  Aroma of banana, clove, spices and yeast. Taste is sweet banana and bubblegum.  Finishes smooth with a little warming.  Very enjoyable on this pleasent evening.

Bottle 33cl. A golden deep beer a nice head. This beer has a typical german weizen flavour but more intensive and with more alcool. Nice fruity weizen a bit sweet, with lemon and grass notes. Its refreshing and very pleasant.

Bottle and served in my Ayinger glassware: Pours a hazy deep golden hue with a frothy head and okay lace. The aroma is more towards the weizen characteristics than the bock, lots of yeasty esters of banana, clove, bubblegum and lemon with some pale and caramel malts. The taste again is more towards the weizen style with spicy and fruity overtones but the malt does seem to peak around the edges and finish. Constant wheat husk on display. The mouth feel is slightly sticky and lively enough, a bit chalky and husky upon the finish. While a good beer I expect my Weizenbocks to display a bit more darker malt tones than this does. Should be coppery to ruby mahogany hued with richer malt notes.

Mmmm...I love me a good Weizen Bock...and thats what this is.   The pour was amber, but slightly lighter in color than some of the other examples of this style.  A wonderful blend of fruity esters, banana and apple flavors notable, clovey spice and malty sweet goodness.   I liked it!

(500 ml bottle from Downeast Beverage) Pours cloudy yellow-golden with a very tall off white head in my weizen. As head recedes there is aroma of banana, bubblegum, fruit, clove and peppery spice. Mouthfeel is wheaty-smooth and rich. Flavor of banana, caramel, clove and peppery spice with a nice light warming boozy quality. Bitterness builds toward finish with a nice bitter bite at the end. Yummy. Ayinger hits the mark again (please, please bring back the Maibock)  - just a well put-together, refined example of a style Ive really come to enjoy and appreciate.

500mL bottle.  Poured hazy medium golden with a fine cap of sticky white head.  The aroma picked up freshly-toasted bananas and cloves.. spicy, clean, and sweet.. just what I was looking for.  The flavor found similar.. sweet, toasted bananas, white pepper, and cloves throughout the drink.. tart lemony wheat accented.. finished with great balance between the spicy notes, tart notes, and banana sweetness.  Medium-bodied and if there was really a "flaw" here, it was that the brew was too clean and too calculated for the style.. balance was spot on, and it went down mighty easily.

Enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in a whiskey snifter.  The beer pours a light amber color, with a sizable and fairly dense white head.  The nose brings a nicely complex combination of classic banana and clove hefeweizen esters, along with notes of Munich and perhaps rostmaltz.  The palate begins fairly fruity/estery, but refrains from being the sort of banana fruity bomb that typify so many American attempts at this and similar styles.  This transitions over to a nice depth of malt character, before ending with a slightly sweet and slightly estery (again, not over-the-top) finish.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden.  No hop bitterness or flavor is detectable.  Carbonation levels are perfect.  Overall, clearly one of the archetypes of the style.

Pours into a weisbier glass cloudy yellow with a massive fluffy white head and a powerful floral yeast aroma. There is a substantial slighlty sour wheat flavor with subtle banana ester and light hop bitterness. Very refreshing.

16.9 oz. bottle, consumed on 3-28-10. Bubblegum and banana scents with a touch of lemon. Light yeast and dusty smells. Very pleasant and appetizing aroma. Pours a surprisingly pale, hazy, yellow-gold with good effervescence. The color is not all that far from that of a typical pale lager. Large amount of fluffy, off-white to light cream-colored head. Cookie taste. A very light, citrusy sourness: Orange. Nice but insubstantial flavors. Creamy taste. Improves upon multiple sips. Light body. Soft in the palate. Yet there is a sharp fizz in the back of the throat. Easy to drink. Seems like a smaller beer than it is, though not in a bad way.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a foamy white head.  Smell is strong of banana, clove and yeast.  Taste leads off with a blast of banana and some spiciness,  wheat is evident with a little bit of citrus that is well balanced with the malt.  Has a sweet dry finish.

Super hazy golden orange coloured body with a very dense white head with microbubbles - NICE! Aroma of yeast, wheat (wouldnt have figured that out from the name!), bananas, bubble gum, coriander seed and some sweet fruit - nice as well. Medium to Full-bodied; Nice strong wheatie tastes with a lot of deep spice tastes, good sweetness and a touch of alcohol. Aftertaste shows a lot of mild tastes with some toffee and a good yeast taste - very nice, well-rounded and complex! Overall, a very nice beer, perhaps one of the best weizen bocks Ive had - showing a lot of character and complexity. I sampled this 50 cL bottle purchased from Liquor Outlet in Boonton, New Jersey on 14-March-2010, sampled at home in Washington on 27-March-2010.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2010 A 16.9 oz refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a cloudy deep golden/light orange color with massive dense white head.  Taste is banana and some clove and finishes with a slightly syrupy sweetness.  Body is medium and lacing is nice.  This is really good beer, but I prefer Weihenstephaner Vitus.

Hazy golden orange. The head here is huge and rocky, constructed of fine bubbles and long lasting, just perfect for the style. The heavily spiced banana nose comes across as warm and fuzzy. Rather sweet and edging towards being too heavy and thick but w/ just enough carbonation to keep the mouthfeel from getting distracting. Still, I would say mouthfeel is a weak-point of this beer. Finishes w/ a spicy bitterness and some sticky sweetness.  Overall, not an exceptional beer but one w/ hints of greatness.
Bottle.  The look is golden orange in color, clear, with a decent white head.  The smell is wheat, fruits, banana, clove, and good. The taste is alcohol, wheat, fruits, clove, and banana.

Bottle. Pour was dark golden with a frothy head. Aroma was of wheat, some sweet malt, Light orange, Clove, and slight banana. Body was medium to light with well blended flavors making this a real easy beer to drink. You cant really go wrong very often with Ayinger.

Pours a cloudy orange with a frothy white head.  Aroma is very musky and basementy yeast with hints of banana.  Moderate carbonation.  Taste is yeasty with a hint of sweet wheat and malt and a mildly bitter lingering hop aftertaste.  Pretty swell stuff.

Murky yellow-orange-brown body, the color of dehydrated urine with protein and blood. Thin, recharging off-white head. Tangy, estery, dusty nose, with hay, lemon, clove, and banana. Sharp, tangy body, with wet hay, lemon, banana, pear and apple juice, and clove, estery and almost sour, with a dusty, spicy, earthy finish. Too much mineraly yeast (this does not pertain as much to the aroma), but still quite good.

Bottle from Sams in Durham.  I love the goat.  Pours dark murkey golden with huge soft white head.  Much lighter than expected.  Nose of bananas and wheat and esters and sweet caramel.  Fairly grainy.  Similar taste, though a tad metallic.  Still quite good.  A bit over-carbonated.
From a bottle poured a slightly hazy straw color with a good amount of head.  Citrusy malty flavor with a quick finish.

Sampled on 3/12/2010. This weizen bock pours a slightly hazy orange gold color from a 50cl bottle. Large sized quickly diminishing white foamy head. The aroma is wheaty and fruity, slightly sweet. A medium bodied weizen bock. The malts are wheaty, fruity and sweet. Some banana and clove a hint of orange, The hops are slightly spicy. Very soft and full carbonation. Hides the alcohol well. Very nice beer. Im not sure if its the hat or the beer the goat is holding in his hoof, but a very cool label. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Dark golden/orange, fluffy/billowy head, fades to film. Aroma is dominated by yeasty dough and clove, hints of banana. Banana shows up much more in the flavor, creates a nice balance with the spicy clove, still very doughy. Mouthfeel is near perfect, carbonation falls apart a tad, still gets a five though. Cant believe this is 7%. Very nice overall.

500 mL bottle from Vintage Cellar in Blacksburg, VA. I love that label. Pours a very hazy orange color with a large pillowy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel, peach and other fruity notes, bread and yeast. Taste is bread, caramel, citrus, bread, cinnamon, toffee, yeasty finish. Medium bodied. This is tasty.

330 ml bottle. BBE 06.10. Finland.
Hazy orange colour with average white head.
Wheat, fruits (banana, abricot), caramel/toffee and some grainy malt in aroma. Notes of bitter hops but mostly wheat, caramel, fruits (banana) and malts in flavour. Hints of crème de banana.

500ml bottle.  Spicy, sweet, malty aroma, featuring copious amounts of clove and banana esters along with lighter degrees of citrus, dough, wheat grain and caramel.  Cloudy medium-dark golden color, head is fine and lasting.  Flavor profile is a pleasant combination of honeyish, sugary malt sweetness, lemon peel, clove and bubblegum with a mildly tart, gently bitter and spicy undercurrent.  Finish sees a touch of dryness creeping in to help offset the abundantly sweet malts.  Highly effervescence, almost fizzy palate, the tartness lending a nicely refreshing quality.  Body is medium.  An enjoyable rendition.
Hazy golden with a big head. Aroma-banana, clove, wheat. Taste- estery with nice wheat and citrus flavors. Medium bodied. Full flavored.

Poured a hazy dark yellow color with an off-white head.  Big banana aroma with a mild yeasty clove spice.  The flavor matched.  Bananas with a yeasty spice.  Light bodied.  Semi-sweet start with a dry finish.

Ayinger does an incredible job with this aromatic, sweet, bock.  I agree with the last reviewer that it seems more weizen than bock but its a wonderful winter ale that is smooth and doesnt show its 7% strength.  Excellent brew!

Completely cloudy gold with a large head.  Strong banana aroma, plenty of bubblegum and cloves.  Bready taste.  Lightly fruity.  Strong wheat.  Thick mouthfeel, yet pretty heavily carbonated.  More weizen than bock, but no complaints here!

The pour is a cloudy yellow orange, definitely unfiltered... foamy white head inviting me into the glass. The aroma consists of bananas, wheat and yeast the taste mirrors those aspects. A very nice bock here that hides the alcohol very well, extremely drinkable and extremely delicious.

Pours a cloudy pale gold with a thick rich white weizen head with plenty of streaming bubbles.  Aroma is cloves and wet french bread.  Taste is classic hefeweizen; plenty of banana, clove and fresh yeasty dough.   A very good hefeweizen with a bit of a kick.

Bottle from BevMo La Jolla.  Pours a cloudy deep golden orange with a frothy off white head that left some awesome lacing on the glass.  Big nose of banana, citrus peel and clove spice.  Palate was reminiscent of vanilla and banana cream, great carbonation and mouth feel.
Bottled 33cl. I am not a big fan ot the style. Fruity with bubblegum showing up, faint reminiscence of persimmon and dust. Sweet. Not bad at all.

Bottled. Pours with a humongous head that fades very quickly and leaves no sort of ring. Mildly filtered with very little sediment. Typical spicy, bubblegum nose feels one dimensional and leaves a lot to be desired. The palate is fine, but the flavor is a bit dull, round, spicy and sweaty, with a non-existent finish. A bit too sweet and lacking in character. A big disappointment from the wheat beer masters.

Pours cloudy tan with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is very nice and balanced with sweet malt, cinnamon, gingerbread, cloves, grass, hay, wheat, caramel, and banana is nicely in the background.  Tastes follows suit with Sweet bread dough malt, sweet potato, caramel, cloves, grass, ginger, and plenty of pungent (rather than fruity) yeast qualities.  Finishes earthy and gentle, like a sweet sourdough bread.  Not heavy, but not light, high carbonation without being irritating, and effortless to drink.  As big and well-made as Aventinus, but with a lighter colored beer.  Hell yes!!

A large ivory head settles over the opaque, dulled down golden hue. I somehow had not expected a pale weizenbock. Profoundly yeasty nose has plenty to offer. Over a bready/toasty bed, phenolic linens procure spicy, clovey, borderline medicinal aromatics while banana bread, apple flesh&rhubarb (without the tartness) and litchi fruitiness provide ample complexity. Highly carbonated on the tongue, its initially explosive bubbles settle to an intense, albeit lightening motion for its considerable malt base. Full toasty breadiness develops an obvious biscuit character as honeyed wheat evocates candied breakfast cereals. Despite its strong maltiness, the yeasty nature and refreshing wheat bill remove any suggestion that this is too sweet. It remains very drinkable from the first to last sip. Competent stuff from these malt extraction experts.

Bottle.  Pours a massive, frothy white head.  Lasting.  Unexpectedly light colored body - rich golden with abundant, pearly carbonation.  Clear body becomes hazy with yeast.  Aroma is big-time yeast, even from across the table.  Vanilla and fruit (tropical) at first.  Closer sniffs reveal big, bready wheat malt and tangy citrus zest from the yeast.  Some requisite clove and a touch of bubble gum.  Flavor has more of the big, rich wheat malt and some banana and spice.  Light, warming alcohol.  Less of the bubble gum, but bigger clove and hints of vanilla and cream.  Medium body is smooth and creamy with lively carbonation.  Big malt presence with just enough bitterness to balance and keep it from being overbearing.  Alcohol comes through in the finish, but isnt distracting.  Lingering spice.  Overall a super beer.  The Ayinger doesnt dethrone Aventinus for me, but its right up there.

50cl bottle.   Well, Ayinger certainly knows how to do bock and weizen, so put the two together and you have a pretty solid beer.   A relatively pale take on the style, though I suspect some munich malt got thrown in there, lending a deep bready and bready-crust maltiness that stands up to the alcohol and spicy banana.   Typical baked banana bread aroma with a dusting of clove.   They got a good attenuation in this though, which makes it quite drinkable, while still packing a lot of malt flavor in.   Yeasty and not really bitter at all, with ripe banana giving way to a generally clean finish.   Medium bodied with ample carbonation.   Very nice for a paler weizen bock, but I still miss the chocolate notes that you get in something like Aventinus.

Great aroma of wheat, coriander, and a little citrus.  Flavor has a little hay, with lots of sugar, orange, coriander again, and a very sweet finish.  A great looking beer, hazy, with a huge head that took some time to drop before I could drink it.

Pleasant aroma of fresh wheat, yeast, and citrus fruits. Tastes of banana, wheat, yeast, and  tangy citrus. Finishes slightly tart and acidic. Very easy to drink and refreshing. Alcohol is deceptive and hits like a brick. Good stuff.
I really love that taste of this beer, it has everything that is great about a hefeweizen with a hint of tartness in the aroma and taste to give it a unique character.

pours a cloudy orange-yellow with a large white foamy head, and great lacing.

smell is of ripe banana, wheat, a touch of citrus, and some spice.

taste is smooth, wheat, and banana, ends creamy.

500ml bottle.
Slightly hazy golden beer body with a large tightly bubbled white head.
Lovelly,honeyish,spicy, banana-bready aromas..very delicious..my mouth is watering.
taste is very similar to the aroma but with a more phenolic quality, and for me hints of marischino cherries. peppery finish.
Nice intresting mouthfeel to this its carbonated but just anough to let this roll over the tongue easily.
very nice beer. i am really enjoying this.

Murky golden color with a lasting, viscous off white head, nice pour.  Tart pale wheat, clove banana estery aromas. Rich smooth mouthfeel. Hearty banana bread, clove, pale wheat flavor is lightly sweet. great wheat brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bright,bubblegum,spicey banana ,wheat tang aroma, that Ayinger does and no one seems able to match,generous weizen head, taste has all the wheat aspects up front they actually fade to background and your left with malt and melanoidin sweetness and German biscuity malt,surpringly different from Aventinus. Excellent

Classic banana and clove nose, with a bit of lemon and sour milk, which may be attributed more to a dirty glass than the beer.  Cloudy golden, thick firm lasting head, abundant streams of carbonation, some lacing. Flavor is of fresh underripe bananas. My experience with weizen beers is that they tend to taste more like overripe bananas, which makes this a little unusual. Not nearly as much clove on the palate as on the nose. Mouthfeel is harsh with too much carbonation. Alcohol is completely imperceptible. Tasty and somewhat unique, but not exceptional.

Oh I told him that the nose plays... the nose plays. Pours a mango juice, low foam .. . wait a minute, horses dont talk, no no nothing about this adds up at all .. . light clove, pear, melon, pie crust .. . tasty stuff- simple no nonsense .. . abv done nicely .. . enjoyable .. i turned canadian so fast!..

Bottled. Lots of banana and yeast in the aroma. Beautiful hazy orange colour. Taste is quite sweet full of yeasty banana. Nice full body and soft mouthfeel. ABV does its job here but stays hidden. A good, very well balanced, strong weizen.

Pours a cloudy orangish color, with a white head. Pleasant enough to drink, notes of several types of unidentifiable fruit. Not my style, but it is still not too bad. However, I will go for something else next time.

At first glimpse, this appears lighter than the typical Weizenbock. This brew is light peach in color and poured an overly luxurious cream head that filled 2/3 the glass. The invigorating presence of yeast and wheat swell the bouquet that has a complex medley of restrained phenols, including clove, banana, vanilla, and touches of uric acid. On the palate, this demonstrates a full bodied 1-2 of wheatiness and yeastiness with the complex presence of phenols again demonstrating moderations. Zesty flavors with mild clove and banana that increases at the sweet yeasty malt finish. Well balanced, full-bodied weizenbock, that is definitely strong, but artfully crafted.

Bottle - Why have I not tried more Ayinger? Every time I drink their beer, Im blown away! This one pours a hazy yellow with a big, white head. Smells just like Dubble Bubble, with wheat and light spice. Yum. The taste is smooth, with lemony wheat, sweet but not overpowering. Its real velvety in the mouth, with silky bubbles and a nice medium body.

A rich, sweet, wheaty bock flavor.  I tasted apple, prune, grape, and floral tones.  Another very good brew from Ayinger!  Now why cant big American brewers be as good?  Maybe it is that old reihensgebot (or whatever).

Hazy peach pour with a vivacious white froth that lingers quite nice. The aroma is simply flabbergasting: massive banana, clove, spice, fruity dough (angelfood cake), toast, biscuit, and caramel. The flavor is spot on- massively bready with huge notes of lemon-orange citrus, nectar fruits, banana, clove, and a pleasant dry smacking characteristic which is presumably from the abv. The palate is medium bodied with the perfect effervescence- pillowy and caressing. The finish is semi dry, and wholly clean.

Hazy peach colored pour with a nice two finger white frothy head. Aroma is pretty excellent; banana, clove, dough, cinnamon, nutmeg, and angel food cake are all fully and boldly represented. Flavor absolutely hits the spot, particularly after a good workout. Great bread and grain character, not in the bad way that those traits are often -- tastes like a beautifully homemade loaf. On top of that are beautiful citrus and tropical fruit notes, along with the aforementioned spices. Palate is full and flavorful, but still immensely drinkable -- Im having trouble not just throwing this down my gullet. This is an awesome weizen bock, and one of the better German beers Ive had. This and Celebrator are now my two favorites from Ayinger.

Bottle courtesy of Chris & Dennis, thank you gentlemen.
Hazy orange color with a fluffy white head that settles quickly to leave good lacing.  Aroma of licorice, bubblegum and grapefruit.  Flavor also has banana and decent malts.  Great example of the style.

Golden color with a decent head. 
Aroma of banana, citrus.
Tastes of cloves, banana, other spices.
Not bad overall.

Bottle.  Pours a murky golden with a dark deep brownish hued center.  Head is large, foamy and leaves rings of thin lacing.  Aroma is rich, redolent of bubblegum, cloves and hints of citrus.  Flavor is full, slightly tart with a sweet bubblegum body.  Malt body is evident but not over powering, making this a fairly light, but flavorful and complex weizenbock. 
Full bodied with an active carbonation.

Golden orange color, large, but not very lasting head; aroma of sweet fruits, banana ester, wheat; mouthfeel is rounded, smooth and thick enough; flavor not as sweet as the nose, banana is not overwhelming, it´s a more likely of sour wheat. There may be not anything hugely original or extreme or complexi in this beer, but it´s very well done and very very drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours to a deeply hazy straw colored body with a tall starch white head.  Nice lacing.  The aroma is bananas and mineral water and a touch of cloves.  The flavor is light bananas, cloves, and a strong frosted bran flakes.  Wheat bread.  The palate is medium bodied and nicely textured.

Aroma of banana and clove. This wheat bock poured an unfiltered, but yet cloudy, golden color. It tasted like amazingness on a hot summer day. It went down smooth and made me thirstier every time I had another sip. Overall this is one of the best weizen-bocks Ive ever had and you should defiantly try it if you love wheat beers.

Pours an orange color, almost looks like Tang.  Nice carbonation and a big fluffy white head.  Nice aroma of bananas, wheat and light citrus.  Goes down easy.  Fruity, a tad sweet and great malt and wheat flavors.  Just a hint of alcohol noticeable at the end.

Pours a cloudy dark straw color with a white head. The main aroma is bready malts and German yeast but you also get some banana and clove. The flavor is heavy on the banana and clove but the bready malts are still there. Thinner mouthfeel and medium carbonation. I had read reviews stating this was basically a souped-up hefeweizen and those reviews were correct. Whatever it is, it is very good.

Pint Bottle. Pours a Golden Orange with white head. Aroma consists of banana with a bit of wheat. Smells somewhat off to me - but yet goes down easy. Very drinkable, and overall not a bad drink. Taste of malty wheat, full bodied.
Much better than I was expecting. Arouma of musk, spice and cloves and some fruit (no banana, sorry). Taste of spice and cinnamon. Very smooth. Finishes with alcohol.
Bottle.  Pours a copper body with a milky white head.  Berries, fruit esters banana notes.  Pear, and citrus ester, some lighter spices clove and a light warming.  Dam fine brew.

Pours rustic grey yellow with a head that rises swiftly to the occaison. Tart banana must on the nose. Medium nectar w/ moderate carbonation. Almost oily in texture. A defined tartness precedes a tropical dispoition. Like milky high pulp banana juice with tons of kiwi. The finish lingers forever.

.5 liter bottle.  Pours a lighter than expected hazy deep blonde- moderate white head- fades a bit.  Aroma is big with fruity banana esters- yet balanced with big fresh restrained clove-phenolics, slight vanilla as well- good fresh doughy wheat malts as well.  Good full sweet wheat malt flavor, doughy, cracker, banana, clove, pepper, good fresh malt sweetness and a clean finish- extremely well done.  Nice.

Beautiful aroma,mostly clove, with a solid dose of banana esters to balance. Color looks beautiful, hazy golden orange with a massive white head. Flavors really showcase the wheat and yeast charcacter. Full bodied, dense mouthfeel, with a rather dry finish. A prime example of the style; outstanding.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a large white head.  Aroma is a nice clove/banana with a bit of lemon in there.  Flavor is creamy with notes of bitterness and wheat malt.  A decent beer and easily drinkable.

Bottle.  Poured a lightly hazy golden-yellow color with an 1 and 1/2 inch, dense white head that receded to a 1/4 inch layer and left some spotty lacing.  Sweet, doughy yeast aroma with hints of wheat, crisp fruit (tangerine, lemon peel, banana), a moderate spiciness (clove), and a light grassy hoppiness.   Crisp, lightly sweet entry with hints of sweet dough, wheat, and clove transitions into a moderate fruitiness with hints of crisp citrus paired with sweeter banana that finishes with a lightly dry grassiness and light undertones of doughy yeast.  Light, yet lively, carbonation rounds out a crisp, easy drinking mouth feel.  Overall, a tasty, enjoyable beer that does seem to share a lot of common traits with its hefe brethren, but that certainly doesnt make it any less enjoyable.

Pours a bright golden brass with a frothy well-lacing white head.  Aroma of light sweet wheat and banana esters with some doughy Bavarian yeastiness.  Starts with pretty good fullness and a sweet light malty body with some lemon citrus and clove spice before a drier toasty toffee finish.  A true to style and enjoyable heller weizenbock.

[Last rating of 2009] Bottle...  Poured a vibrant, cloudy, golden/orange with a huge white head.  Aroma of cloves, coriandor and wheat malts.  Crisp, refreshing, on the dry side with a fruity, hoppy balance to the otherwise sweet, wheaty base.  Finished with banana like notes.

Bottle from the Orland Park, IL, Binnys:  This pours a hazy yellow body with a substantial head and laces the glass nicely.  The aroma is sweet and doughy with fresh bananas and a light spiciness.  Pretty much the same wth the flavor, except that it has a hit of alcohol near the end.  Except for that hit and a dryness to the finish, I wouldve been sure that this was a hefeweizen.

Hazy orange with a fluffy white head. Sweet fruity banana aroma with nutmeg and other yeasty spicy notes, and a light lemony citrus hint. The flavor has spicy notes up front, with notes of nutmeg and anise, and some sweeter notes of banana. Love it.

50cl bottle.  Large white head atop murky apple cider body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, clove, bubble gum, light banana.  Taste is moderately sweet, clove, some bubble gum, banana, light alcohol warming.  Creamy medium body.

Bottle poured a hazy golden yellow with a lasting cremy white head. Aromas of wheat, banana, spice and light sulfer. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a smooth finish. Flavors of wheat, banana, spice, light carmel and light sulfer with a smooth spiced finish.

Golden pour with light white head.  Aroma of yeast, clove, and banana.  Initial taste is of sweet malts and banana.  This is followed by spices and finishes with banana, other fruits, and mild spices.

Bottle at Bodegar, in San Juan. Cloudy ochre with tall off-white head and no lace. Noticeable aroma of bready yeast ripe apples and banana. Flavour of bananas, dried fruit and some over-ripe apples. Nice carbonation. Lingering sherry alcohol finish.

Nice malty aroma with notes of banana, clove, and alcohol.  Cloudy, slightly dark amber, but not nearly as dark as I expected of a weizen bock.  It Medium sweetness with an alcoholic twang, maybe a touch of bitterness in there.  If you want an hefe with more complexity and kick, this is it.
Pours a hazy golden amber color. Aromas of clove, banana, fruit, and alcohol. Flavor is alcoholic clove and spice with a bittersweet finish. Good beer, just not something I would have often.

Bottle. Cloudy gold with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is slightly sour wheat, bananas, clove/spice, big bubblegum, sweet malt and light caramel. Taste is big banana, caramel, ripe fruit, sweet malts, spices, wheat, cream and yeast. Body is light-medium and very bubbly with strong, prickly carbonation. Ends with more caramel, sweet malts, chocolate-covered banana, wheat, yeast and spic notes. Very tasty and more along the lines of Vitus than Aventinus. Me likey!

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a large white head and some murky grey sediment.  Sweet malt and a light musky banana yeast note.  Spicy and tingly, but a little bit papery and sweet.  Finishes up with more spicy yeast and some caramel notes.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a big, fluffy, lasting white head.  Has a very nice aroma with lost of spicy yeast and fruitiness, with banana and a touch of citrus noticeable.  Has a bready wheat malt flavor, with the clove-like spiciness also coming through a lot.  The banana is more pronounced on the flavor to me than in the aroma, as well as bubblegum.  Hides the alcohol extremely well, I felt almost no alcohol presence despite the higher percentage.

Very good Weizenbock with lots of banana/bubblegum flavor.  This beer pours the color of a lightly bruised banana peel.  The liquid is very cloudy and the head is enormous and creamy.  The aroma is all quality German wheat.  Theres a lot of sweet banana and bubblegum with a touch of clove.  It reminds me more of Vitus than Aventinus.  The flavor has just about the perfect level of sweetness to complement the aroma, and it finishes with just a kiss of hop bitterness.  Aying is a truly great brewery.

Bottle  Pours a cloudy light gold with a good white head.  The head is frothy and lasts well.  Lacing is good.  Has a sweet aroma of bubble gum, banana, cloves, and some bread.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good, crisp and sweet, very refreshing.  Has a medium body.  The texture is thin.  Has a good finish with a nice aftertaste.  This is a tasty refreshing beer a good thirst quencher.

Bottle. Hazy dark yellow body with a small, frothy white head that sticks around. Aroma of sweet banana, clove, lemon, bread and dust. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly acidic. It finishes lightly sweet, moderately acidic and lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, velvety texture and lively carbonation. Very nice beer all around. It starts fruity and sweet with notes of spice. Those tastes give way to a light bitterness and nice tartness. Add a full, smooth mouthfeel. Ayinger brews lots of excellent beers and this is another one. Very enjoyable.

bottle...cloudy deep golden pour, huge white head ,sparse lacing .Aromas of wheat ,yeast and banana . Flavor is fruity (banana) and sweet with a touch of caramel towards the finish . Finish is dry .Medium bodied ,light carbonation.

Cloudy straw (I was expecting it slightly darker) with a thick white creamy cap that hangs around for a while.  Banana and bubble gum with a mild spice aroma.  Nice carbonation level that fits the style.  7.1 ABV is hardly noticeable.  Nice clean somewhat filling finish.  An excellent Fall/Spring brew.

Name: Weizen-Bock
Date: November 13, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Hop City, Atlanta
Appearance: hazy dark yellow, frothy creamy white head
Aroma: sweet wheat aroma, nice banana sweetness, light spicyness
Body: creamy body
Flavor: rich sweet banana flavor, light spicyness, the wheat adds a nice lightness to offset the richness of the banana
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.7/5.0Drinkability: 8/10

Pours a hazy golden yellowish orange color with golden ripe banana yellow hues when held to a light source and a lot of visible carbonation bubbling up. Two finger frothy white head that quickly fizzles into a lasting cap. A lot lighter colored than I expected.

Yeasty aroma with hints of fresh bread, crisp light fruit, citrus peel and subtle zesty spice. Hints of ripe banana, apple, lemon peel, zest peppery spice and subtle clove. Slightly earth and funky.

Fuller end of medium bod with a lot of smooth bread yeast. This gives the beer a lot of its full body and contributes wonderfully to the flavor. Lots of zesty, peppery spice and crisp citrus fruit are very well integrated making this beer extremely flavorful and quite complex. Plenty of ripe banana along with hints of apple, lemon zest, pepper, clove and citrus lemon peel. All of these flavors are extremely well balanced with no one flavor overpowering the other and the ABV is excellently masked making this beer extremely quaffable. Highly recommended for German wheat beer fans or anyone really. Excellent!

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2011 In bottle; color-golden, honey. aroma-spice, banana, citrus.Taste-very good, I was expecting a little stronger of a taste at 7.1% but solid citrus (lemon) notes, with subtle banana, wheat, grassy, and spice notes. Overall a very good beer.

Bottle from Liquor Barn @ SpringhurstThis one has been on my wants list for a while, so I was very excited to see it locally. Pours hazy yellow/golden with a thin foamy eggshell head. Notes of banana, mild clove, sweet pale malt, thick mash, and spice. Full bodied with lively carbonation. I did enjoy this beer quite a bit, but I can tell its basically their hefe with more malt. Still quite enjoyable.

Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy golden color with an enormous yellow-white head that lingered forever. The aroma was bready, yeasty and had notes of bubblegum, clove and citrus. The flavor was sweet, tart and yeasty with a strong bubblegum and clove presence. The finish was long and reminded me of sourdough bread. The body was thick, full and chewy. Well done.

Recent bottle. Pours big head on lighter yellow body. Aroma is pure bannana, good thick mouthfeel, and bannana in the taste. More like a hefeweizen. Drinkability was good. I was looking for more of an edge and complexity I love so much in weizenbocks. This was full, just the bannana overode the taste department.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 125h rating for this beer - my 19th Weizenbock and easily my favorite.  Bottle.  Ooooh baby!  Bottle itself hasnt even been recycled yet.  Nose is super malty, dry though, light brown sugar and light cloves.  Light golden body (surprisingly so) with visibly strong carbonation.  Head is a pillow, soft and densely bubbled.  Medium body, soft and smooth.  Taste of medium bananas, heavy bubblegum, seemingly a little candy sugar, indistinct berry.  Malt profile is gentle on the whole but theres a frisk side lurking under the surface.  Aftertaste is dry and pure honey-malty goodness.  Vanilla, cream, light meringue, light lemon zest.  Light and refreshing, no muddy or grainy malt, absolutely no sign of the strongish alcohol.  A pleasure to drink, and an extremely promising offering for a style that was leaking hope.  Manna, poetry, gift of the ancient eagle, stolen by Odin and given to man to reward his faith. [2009.12.10: 4.5]Another bottle, coincidentally almost on the sixth anniversary of my last.  Spice sets this apart from many other bocks, weizens, and weizenbocks, as does the great creamy-yeasty underpinning.  Fruit melds perfectly with citrus, perfect crispness and full of life.  Touch, oily-sticky, late-arriving grape, alcohol makes itself known (more like 9%!) but doesnt hurt.  Really strong, bright wheat.  Bubblegum getting a little out of control, but otherwise a killer!  And I like how this maintains identity as a supercharged HW rather than a mutt. [2015.12.08: 4.3]

Pours hazy dark yellow / orange with a fluffy white head.  The aroma has creamy wheat, some banana esters, light spices and is a bit rich.  Medium / full body with lots of flowing soft carbonation.  The taste is like the aroma, but is very smooth and full with smooth wheat and some cinnamon-like spice on the finish with lots of effervescence.  This is very nice.  Its not as complex as some in the style, but everything that is her is solid.

Pours an oddly hazy golden, expecting something darker, huge sustained rocky head... Aroma of overripe banana, clove, big floral aroma, wheat, yeast, bubblegum... Very flavorful up front, notes of banana and clove dominate, taste is of strong hefe... Almost a thin finish for the style/weight, overly drinkable, lingering banana flavors, medium bodied, Very Good, but not at the top of the list...

50cL bottle, no date.  Opaque goldenrod (damn you crayola), stark white foam, decent retention and great lacing.  Big banana nose with some bubble gum.  Flavor falls real flat, bubble gum up front that fades rapidly to... not much, a little bit of wheat grain and not much else.  Palate seems really thin also.  Big letdown for me, came into thinking "ZOMG I LOVE Celebrator and Brau Weisse, this is going to be AWESOME".  Stupid expectations.

Poured into weizen and produced a large foamy head that released a lovely aroma.  The aroma includes spices, grain, wheat, and some light fruits.  Taste expands on those with a definite banana, bubblegum, and alcohol palate and a nice smooth finish.  Not very carbonated or biting.  OK weibock

Pours deep hazy gold into a weizen.  Bright white micro head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Bubblegum and clove aromas. Crisp with sweet caramel and bubblegum upfront turning to a dry banana clove finish.

Pours a nice cloudy amber orange with a profuse creamy/sticky offwhite head. Nose shows banana, soft wheat, bready, mild malty sweetness, spicy clove. Flavor shows clove and banana, prominent wheat, mild grassy hops. Palate is creamy with some spice.

500mL bottle.  Pours a very cloudy orange, highy carbonated, white foamy head.  Huge aroma of clove and banana, lots of wheat malt.  Very sweet flavor, rich wheat, clove, and a bit of banana puree.  Heavy bodied, rich and flavorful.   Overall, it finishes with a forward charge of bold hefeweizen character.  Lots of hefe... its and Imperial German Hefe.  Awesome and rich.
Pours hazy golden orange with a big off white head.  Aroma is banana, spice, and light fruits.  Flavor is wheaty, malty, with some banana and clove in there as well.  Very good.

Bottle from Bottle Barn. Pours hazy orange gold with a foamy, 4-finger white head. Very nice banana aroma, backed by a little clove. Medium body with foamy carbonation. Flavor is wheat, followed by clove, and then banana, finishing different banana impact. Really good stuff. Its very tasty. Banana in the long haul.

500ml bottle.  Cloudy golden-tan color, lighter than I wouldve expected.  Big foamy off-white head.  Some wheat and banana is the aroma.  The mouthfeel of this beer is awesome.  Smooth, sweet malt tones.  Well-defined hefe-yeast banana-clove flavor.  Creamy and thick, with some light pungency underneath.  Wow, this beer is excellent.  World class German beer.

Wow a delicious weizenbock by a brewery I would expect it from. Aroma was big and full. Very thick banana aroma witha  hint of clove and some yeast. Pour was a nice murky orange with a one finger white head. Taste was full of flavor...strong banana and clove with a nice yeasty character. Thick mouthfeel and strong carbonation. Man, if you like German beers you cant go wrong with Ayinger.

text: Poured the same color as a regular Hefe with a frothy head. Good added malt flavours and a ton of yummy yeast at the bottom of the bottle.

Interesting bottle, Cant say i know exactly the size, but I was attracted by the label and the brewer.  I liked this shared with my brother over poker with the fam.  Pours yellow with a 1 finger tan head.  Nose is nice big, sweet and full of wheat.  Taste is sweet, wheaty quaffable and yummy!

Pretty solid Weizen bock. Aroma is loaded with bananas, vanilla and clove. Flavor is similar, with some hints of citrus and yeast. Alcohol is warming with a smooth mouthfeel.  The vanilla was a good addition.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium size head that recedes quickly. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat, bread. Mouthfeel is more carbonated than I would have guessed. Reminds me more of a strong hefeweizen than a weizen bock.

500ml bottle thanks to fidelis83 (also available locally now). Pours with a large, fluffy white head over a milky to muddy deep golden body. Aroma is grassy with clove, banana, suntan lotion, caramel, raisins and some other spicy phenols. Taste is nice and clove like with rum and light banana. Some raisins. Tastes fresh and green. Lively bubbles.

This beer pours a cloudy dull yellow with a large white head.  No noticeable lacing.  The aromas are banana, bubblegum,  and clove.  The flavors are Bananas, light cloves and some bubblegum.  This is a great beer!  Cheers!

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 bottle. beautifully hazy bready yellow colored body with a fine-bubbled tall white head.  nose is wonderfully vibrant and fresh lemon zest, dried grass, mild banana and light clove.  very much like a hefeweizen, active floral yeast, very fresh, very refreshing.  rich, crisp and vibrant up front - tight carbonation with a mildly chewy wheat character form the rich but light body, while zesty yeast esters of floral banana and lemon linger.  very nice.

Poured to a fluted fest glass at Brixies Holiday Beer Tasting in Brookfield, IL. The color was a hazy straw tone, with tight, small white bubbles to a modest head, almost nitro-ish. The lacing was merely clingy spots. The aroma was lightly grassy, a hint of yeast, some mid-tone fruit, banana, spice, and a little tartness. The flavor was similar, adding some lively carbonation with maybe a medium to medium light body. A nice, enjoyable example of the style.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of banana, light bubblegum, yeast, clove, and some faint mustiness.  It pours a cloudy orange with a large white head with excellent retention and spotty lacing.  The flavor starts with moderate citrus along with some light banana and bubblegum.  The finish is light-moderately spicy with some clove.  Its medium bodied and the carbonation is lively but never gets to the point of being prickly.  In my opinion, it comes across more like a bigger Hefeweizen  rather than a Weizen Bock.
500ml bottle. Pours hazy lemon-golden with white head. Nose of minerals, eggs, bananas, and cloves. Flavors of banana, clove, hawain bread, with a cashew finish. Spritzy carbonation, light body.

Bottle.Pours a deep, cloudy lemon orange with an explosive aroma of banana and clove; litereally, after the bottle is opened, the aroma shoots into the nose. Flavor is a bit of a let-down, a watery banana finished off by blunt and boring clove.  Nice mouthfeel.  Overall, not too bad.

text: 500ml bottle - hazy light orange - effervescent body that kicks up an impressive head, but fails to sustain it well - aroma of earthy wheat, mustiness, yeast, clove/banana phenols, some orange-like tanginess, - smells like an imperial hefe - carbonation is full in the mouth, but soft - fairly yeasty - a mild sweetness serves only to balance a moderate acidity and tartness/tanginess - phenolic flavors are more subdued than the aroma suggests - some wheaty/grainy flavors make way for a more dry malt character that carries through the finish - things are capped off with a moderate alcohol warmth - this really is, basically, an imperial hefe, and a fairly good one at that.
Bottle. Hazy bright yellow.  Strong carbonation.  Nose is lemony, tart, yeasty, wheaty, sharp. Taste is very yeasty, a bit sweet and nosy. German yeast and alcohol very evident. Drinks nicely.

16.9 oz bottle picked up at Macs on West Peachtree. Nice looking brew. Murky orange/yellow color with a beautiful fluffy head. Very aromatic brew. Sweet orange, banana, and yeast coming through. Citrus orange comes through more in the aroma than in the taste, but still a damn fine beer. Nice extremely creamy, but has an average palate. Very impressed with this offering.

Pours a orangey light golden color, with a medium to large sized foamy white head. Lively somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Taste is honey, bubble gum, caramel drizzle, orange rind, a little bit of banana and bread pudding.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in Plano, TX. Pours a very nice looking cloudy, dirty yellow with big white head. Aroma and flavor just loaded with wheat malt, banana, a little clove, orange and lemon grass, a little earthy. Mouth feel is medium body with medium-high carbonation. Overall, great shit!
This beer is superb.  Light banana and grain aroma.  Rich mouthfeel, with a flavor that is rich yet ephemeral.

500ml bottle.  Pours a clear, just slightly hazy, glowing golden orange with a very tall thicker foamy dense white head.  Aroma is lovely German, meaty yeasty, sweet ripe banana, lightly nutty, hint of alcohol, straight banana laffy-taffy, hint of spiciness. Bottle, orange julius color with lasting foam,

500ml bottle served in a Weizen glass. Bottle conditioned. Poured a hazy gold with three fingers of white head. Lots of carbonation per style. Nice mix of clove and banana in the aroma. Medium bodied with a smooth mouthfeel. Good and spicy with clove in the finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Very easy drinking for the ABV. Classic rendition of a Weizenbock.

As it warms the dusty bubblegum, pear and banana notes come out a little more, the lemon zest becomes a little less pronounced and the earthy flavors are present over a longer period of time. Palate is medium bodied, super creamy on entry, somewhat chalky, yet creamy to the finish and somewhat sticky.

Pours a very hazy yellow with a tall fluffy white head. The aroma is lemon zest, bread dough and light clove. The flavor is doughy and bready, spicy and clove like, there are light hints of alcohol and the banana sweetness is well controlled. Delicious.
Pours a light hazy orange color with a lot of white head, could be a little darker for a Weizen Bock.  Strong banana aroma.  Medium bodied with a nice sweet banana and malt flavor.

Poured a  hazy orange/gold with a nice head that dissapates fairly quick.  Esters stand out here in aroma and flavor.  Fruity, with just a slight bitter to balance it.  Just a tad strange though, with a banana-pineapple-pepper taste - good, just hit me a bit odd. What I do have to really give this beer is its wonderful palate.  Smooth, full (but not overful or chewy) mouthful that made it so very drinkable. Got even better once it opened up for a few minutes - and the 7.1% is completely hidden.  Good.  Id drink it again.

The beer pours prototypical weizen bock-like.  Got a strong medium head that sits on top of a very cloudy and hazy dark golden body.  Visible carbonation bubbles bum-rush the surface of the beer.  The head just sticks around and around and around.  Some light passing through the beer but generally a medium clarity.  Aroma, aroma, aroma, what can I say about the aroma... its exactly what the Germans do best (no not kill), make beautiful and bountiful wheat beers.  Aroma is fully of grainy, brown banana smells.  Its wunderbar, love the esters, very well done, I could smell this for a while.  The grainy aspect and a very earthy type of banana ester versus an overly fruity one makes this very good aroma. Flavor is toned down dark banana esters as well.  A nice estery beer without being overly fruity.  A nicely fuller yet light mouthfeel really works well with the structure of the beer.   500mL bottle in a Blind Tiger Brewery weizen glass, was able to pour the whole bottle and still have room to spare.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of wheat, spices, clove, slight banana, light coriander, and hints of pepper and ginger. Bottle. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma is rich wheat, yeast overtones, mild spice. Flavor is lightly sweet, very mild bitterness, nourishing bread, light fruit. Finish leaves a wonderful aftertaste. Simple and exceptional.

500 ml bottle from the Utah State Store. Pours out a cloudy apricot color with a large white foamy head. The aroma is super sweet spicy malts. Banana and pepper. The flavor is similar; a smooth rich banana, pepper, citrus and overall malty flavor. A great mouthfeel. Nice.

Great spicy banana bread nose with a good frothy white head. Pale dark yellow/light orange pour. Very crisp and clean. banana taste immediately with a nice bread flavored finish lingering on the palate.

From the Bayou. 33cl bottle, Alko. Large head, yeast and banana aroma. Full bodied, must try again, nice one.
Strong yeast aroma with light amounts of wheat. Cloudy golden color with a medium white head. Strong and lightly bitter beginning with a sweet finish.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2009 Aroma was notes of yeast, bananas, cloves and something a little funky, maybe like old shoes. Flavor is pretty lively, with bananas, citrus, cloves, vanilla, yeast and wheat. Pretty tasty brew, except for that faint hint on the aroma.

A Mes rate: bottle from the Bottle Stop drunk at home.Clean brownish gold with a good white head. Really good weisse aroma. Big nanas and good vanillary hints. I rarely get excited about this style of beer but tonight I have had two crackers right next to each other. Luscious creamy alcohol finish with some late, late clove rounds it off beautifully. Palate is perfect for the style. A great beer.

Bottle.  Peach, banana, clove and wheat malt aroma - alcohol apparent.  Cloudy orange-tan color with large head.  Sweet banana/apricot and wheat malt flavor - light alcohol astringent finish.  Tasty and smooth - very nice.

Bottle at Zly Casy, Prague
Pours hazy orange, with a creamy white head.Aroma is full of malt, notes of banana and citrus. Full bodied. Taste is banana, wheat, orange, this is a remarkable beer

Bottle brought home from Helsinki. 
Pours cloudy orange with a dense white head. 
It has a nice quite complex aroma with lots of bananas, some citrus, clove and a little spice. 
Flavour is banana, clove and malt with a hint of alcohol. 
Quite good.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow body with a fluffy white head. Lots of banana in  aroma with clove, light citrus and light smoke. Flavour is sweet malt, banana, clove and light alcohol. Medium bodied. Nice brew.
Molto gustosa weizenbock che ho avuto il piacere di assaggiare da Eataly a Torino, accompagnata ai wurstel che avevano una pellaccia tale che se gli sparavi con una pistola rimbalzava il proiettile.

33cl bottle @ Aying Brauerei. Pours cloudy orange with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose is deep malty and sweet with notes of clove, citrus, banana, wheat. Smooth and full bodied. Taste is orange peel, wheat and coriander/clove. Very tasty...

Bottled	A hazy light orange coloured beer with a lasting tight white head.  The aroma is good with notes of banana and clove together with lemon and more spices.  The taste is more of the same with added vanilla.  Good strength of alcohol and nicely tasty.
(33cl bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a thick white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, grass,orange, and wheat.  Flavor of wheat, banana, lemon peel, and clove.

Bottle. Clear-to-opaque apricot trumpet fizzing madly beneath a high silky white head. Aroma is wow; toffee apple rolled in clove, orange rind, lemon meringue pie, dribble making Bazooka chew, lemon sherbet, bananas on toast sprinkled with cinnamon, Hoegaarden and all manner of sexual confectionary. Fat and lovely with honeyed banana, clove; candy cigarettes and gentle warming alcohol. Bulbous exotic spice without spice. How do they do it?? A beer to simply marvel at, whilst chucking a few pints down your neck. Its wintery, its summery, its perfect fireside refreshment for an English May evening with a gale howling down the chimney and the rain lashing against the windowpane. Top 10 material, no questions.

from beerangel.de - pours a cloudy dark orange colour with a giant and creamy white foam; aroma of overripe bananas with yeasty notes; very sweet, thick and heavy, very long banana finish wwith a late alcohol touch - one-dimensional and a little bit cloying

quite huge and lasts long. Aroma is quite disgusting. Wheaty fruitiness in the flavor is warming and quite nice. Probably Ill re-rate this one next winter, should this be available in Finland then.

33cl bottle straight from Munich courtesy of my mother-in-law in the funky new Sam Adams glass which is almost weizen shaped.  Cloudy orange with big fluffy white head and lotsa lace.  Lots of banana clove bubble gum bread and citrus in the aroma.  Sweet peach apricot vanilla with medium wheat tang and sweet vanilla finish.  No alcohol burn and no residual bitterness.  Just delicious and complex for the style.   Awesome.
Bottle. Pours a murky orange with a white head. Aroma of wheat, banana and cloves. The flavour is wheat, banana, cloves and yeast. Medium bodied and sweet finish.
Very rich flavored and spicy. Have to go for more ayingers. good looking. Banana and yeast. some citrus fruits too.

Pours a cloudy, orange color with a fluffy, persistent, slightly off-white foamy head. Moderately sweet malts, wheat like chalky aroma with light fruity notes (citrus, banana) and restrained clove notes.  Flavour is sweet and fruity with notes of vanilla, wheat and clove tones. Finishes fresh with a light bitterness and a citric touch to it.  Nice beer.

Bottle, Carringtons, Chorlton. Hazy, pallid orange colour with a dissipating white head. Yeasty, banana and clove aroma. 
Sweetish flavour, but not overwhelmingly so. Nice citrus flavours going down with a pleasant booze hit.  A very tidy effort that I would definitely have again.

Bottle. Golden color. Hazy. Nice white head. Nice aroma of wheat and fruit (orange). Add vanilla and spices to it. Tastes like an "imperial weissbier". Full bodied! Big taste! Hints of vanilla and lots of fruit makes it elegant. Bitterness from the alcohol appears in the aftertaste to complete this fantastic brew.
Bottle from Tbone, thanks! Orange blonde, cloudy. Mandarine curacao and clove in the aroma. Very fruity flavor (banana, tangerine, mango, pineapple) mixed with some warming alcohol. Nice one!

Bottle at Microbar, Clapham, "Just a quick one" session, 18th Dec 08 (well, by this point, in the early hours of the 19th!) Classic weiss taste but not too citrus, with lots of bock malt there. This is a man’s weiss beer! Heavenly aroma - orange peel, wheat, fresh dough. Clear yellowy amber colour with a persistent white head. Smooth, full bodied. Soft, foamy, clean finish. A bottle from Alko shop. Soft banana in the nose. Hazy pale yellow colour. Soft banana sweetish taste. Warming. Soft foaminess.
Bottle.  Golden orange with a small head.  Aromas are caramel malts with yeast and nutty notes.  Flavours are sweet caramel and wheat with bready yeast.  Slightly smoky with evident alcohol.  Decent.

Pours with creamy, medium-sized head. Beer itself is hazy, slightly reddish yellow. Aroma is very sweet and fruity. Banas and plums are clearly present. Als some coriander and yeastiness and some alcoholic tones in the finish. Flavor is just sweet just enought but not overtly. There is also some sour yeast and a hint of sharp spiciness. Palate is well rounded, smooth and almost perfectly carbonated. Medium bodied. Alcohol is warming in the finish. Super easy to drink for such a strong beer.
330 ml bottle. Cloudy golden color, frothy white head. Fruity aroma with cloves. Spicy flavor with wheat and some yeast. Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Quite tasty.
Bottle at ØLbaren - thanks. Clear yellow - white head. Sweetness, banana, weaty, alcoholic, citrus, yeasty. Unpleasant.

Hazy orange-yellow colour, thin white head. Malty, fruity aroma with a hint of alcohol. Medium-bodied, foamy mouthfeel. The flavour is malty, wheaty, a little sour, with banana, yeast and alcohol warmth.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 33cl bottle. Hazy opaque yellow, big foaming pale head. Banana ice-cream nose, spritzy wheat, little clove, very smooth, actually reminds me of Lammin sahti. Sweeeet wheaty flavor, banana, herbs, little creamy vanilla and alcohol. A tad too sugary sweet even. Almost full bodied, strong carbonation. Good, but not exceptional.

Very beautiful orange beer with big white head. Aroma is pleasant: Wheats, yeasts, bananas, some bitterness and even some lemon. Flavour is also nice and it is similar than aroma: wheat, yeast, some sweet banana, but not anymore bitterness. Quite full-bodied to drink and same time nicely slippery and smooth. Ayinger Weizen-Bock is great, more bootilicious than normal hefe that is still lightly wheatish and nice to drink.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour with a creamy white head. Malty aroma with notes of wheat and yeast. The flavour is sweet, malt, wheat, yeast and banana. Medium bodied, well-balanced, sweet and slightly bitter finish. Delicious weizenbock.
Hazy yellow with a soapy white head. Strong, wheaty aroma with some banana. Mild flavor with almost more banana than wheat. Still it’s a very good, easily drinkable weizen.

Bottle. It pours a hazy orange-golden body leaving a small off-white head. There’s a touch of alcohol in the aroma, but most of all there’s sweetness, caramel and banana. Also some cloves. It has a sweet flavor with banana, some citrus and cloves and a nice bitterness. Sure on the fruity and sweet side. Medium to full body, effervescent, with a nice warming feeling. Sweetness, banana, cloves and bitterness in the finish. A lovely beer, well suited for an hour by the fire. (080829)
Bottle. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma sweet, banana, wheat. Flavour is sweet, banana, caramel, coriander. Nice beer.
The bottle looks really good, the beer in the glass like a normal hefeweizen. Yeasty and fruity aroma. Tastes modest fruity, strong yeasty without being too dry. Another great brew from Ayinger!

in the bottle thanks to hurrisnow. pours an opaque candlewax gold with a huge head. big ester aroma. overripe bananas and cloves. this tastes like banana pudding. theres an incredible thickness to this beer. the mouth is just perfect. it has a cake of esters with a mildly drying finish. the sweetness is ripe banana sweet. I dont think Ive ever tasted quite like this in beer.

Bottle. Hazy medium yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate to heavy yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (170408)

(Bottle 33 cl) Courtesy of Maria. Hazy golden with a tall and lively off-white head. Aroma of yeast and banana. Medium body with sweet banana esters and cloves - kinda like fruit bubblegum perhaps. 290308

Loads of esters in the aroma - bananas, cloves and perhaps apricot.

Not really that Bock-like. A bit on the dry side and rather light in colour, so its more like a weizen, just a little bit stronger.

Banana, salty liquorice, light bitterness, malts and bit of fruitiness in taste. Sweet and salty aftertaste.

Bottle - Beautiful a little to unclear body with an elegant creamy head; Slightly fruity round a little to straight forward nose with a few well hidden nuances; The body is initially very round , a little fatty with a slightly acidy touch; It moves smoothly into a little to discrete finish with lots of aromas, balanced and complex. Pours a hazy amber with a white, rocky head. Very sweet with aormas of banana and cereals. Hint of bread too. Full bodied. Soft carbonation. The finish is sweet, with some bitterness and a hint of bread. I like most of it apart form the finish.

0.5L on draft at Ayingers Speis und Trank during 2007 Oktoberfest in Munich
When youre tired of the tents and fairgrounds of Oktoberfest and want to sit and savor some of the greatest liquids on Gods green Earth, walk through the Marienplatz and head to Speis und Trank.  This beer was 0.5L of heaven in a glass.  Truly a memorable dark wheat offering from one of the best brewers youll find (in my humble opinion, obviously).  Wonderful clove aromas augment a beautiful malt flavor that just seduces the front of your taste buds.  I believe that this beer went into a wooden barrel less than 24 hours before I drank it.  The freshness was that apparent.  This is a near-perfect brew, one that did not disappoint my lofty expectations for Ayinger.  On par for this style in quality as is Ayingers Celebrator for the doppelbock style.  Damn fine.

330ml bottle bought at the Brauereigastof in Aying in June 07 and enjoyed at home in Tromsø from an original Ayinger glass. Served slightly chilled. Hazy, pale orange body supported by a creamy, white  head, slowly fading. Enjoying aroma of overripe banana blend with clove. Balanced taste of sweet sappy and acidulous fruits. Wheaty freshness is also noticeable. Moderate yeasty ending. More weizen than bock, but still very pleasant to drink (Tromsø, 08.09.2007).

Nice tasting, solidly crafted beer.  Not as yeasty as most others of the style, noticeable but not overwhelming spice which matches nicely with the more laid back style.  Balanced hops with the slightly sweet malt taste.  Good overall effort.

On tap @ Ayingers, Munich. Pours hazy dark orange, with a tall and creamy head.Sweet aroma of bananas. Taste is malty, yeast and bread. Warmig alcohol in the end. Very good weizen bock

Bottled at Teerenpeli Kaisaniemi, Helsinki.  Muddy pale orange, creamy head. Powerful aroma of banana and cloves. Less sweet than many other weizenbocks and more drinkable. Mild and nowhere near overpowering. Like a hefeweizen just ramped up one small notch.
